analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis zla ba drug gis yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub mchog 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsungs so //
translated: Thus declared the Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi.

original: @102b de nas rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: @102b de nas rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Then, the consecration of the vajra name, and so forth, are also like that.

original: de nas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa yang byas nas yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i cho gas bsgrubs la 'byung bar bya zhing dkyil 'khor chen po'i gsang ba bsgrub pa lan gcig bya'o //
analyzed: de nas byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa yang byas nas yang ji ltar 'dod pa'i cho gas bsgrubs la 'byung bar bya zhing dkyil 'khor chen po'i gsang ba bsgrub pa lan gcig bya'o //
translated: Then, having also performed the consecration, and so forth, one should accomplish and emerge by means of the rite as desired, and the secret accomplishment of the great maṇḍala should be performed once.

original: de nas slob ma gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas slob ma gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should induct the disciples.

original: de la dang por rdo rje slob dpon gyis dang po'i rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por rdo rje slob dpon gyis dang po'i rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: First, the vajra master should bind the mudra of the first joy, the vajra, and enter.

original: zhugs nas de bzhin du phyag byas la snying pos ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i tshig dang / bcom ldan 'das bsgrubs pas phyag rgya chen pos bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas de bzhin du phyag byas la snying pos ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i tshig dang / bcom ldan 'das bsgrubs pas phyag rgya chen pos bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having entered, having made homage in the same way, with the essence mantra and whatever words are desired, one should accomplish the Bhagavat with the great seal.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das bsgrubs pas mtshan ma de nyid 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das bsgrubs pas mtshan ma de nyid 'byung ste /
translated: Then, having accomplished the Bhagavat, that very sign will arise.

original: shes nas phyag rgya chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes nas phyag rgya chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowing that, the great seal will be accomplished.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: All powers will be accomplished.

original: zhugs pa 'dis ni rdo rje slob dpon bdag nyid de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhugs pa 'dis ni rdo rje slob dpon bdag nyid de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this entry, the vajra master himself will be accomplished in the same way.

original: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje blang ba la sogs pa byas nas rdo rje slob ma la cho ga rgyas pa 'di bzhin du byas te phyag rgya bcing ba yang bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje blang ba la sogs pa byas nas rdo rje slob ma la cho ga rgyas pa 'di bzhin du byas te phyag rgya bcing ba yang bslab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken up the vajra in the same way, and so on, having performed the extensive rite for the vajra disciple in this way, one should also train in binding the mudra.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i dam tshig la mos pa de rnams la yang rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i dam tshig la mos pa de rnams la yang rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa dang / de bzhin du yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, for those who are devoted to the commitments of all the Tathāgatas and so forth, the extensive ritual for entering into one’s own special deity will be successful, and likewise all the powers that are desired will be accomplished.

original: de nas @103a *//
analyzed: de nas @103a *//
translated: Then,

original: lha gzhan dag la dad pa rnams la de bzhin du 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par byas nas de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha gzhan dag la dad pa rnams la de bzhin du 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas par byas nas de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: for those who are devoted to other deities, the extensive ritual for entering into them will be successful, and likewise they will be accomplished.

original: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams zas dang / ro bcud dang / gnas pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yang dag par tshim par byas la /
analyzed: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams zas dang / ro bcud dang / gnas pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis yang dag par tshim par byas la /
translated: Then, those who have entered should be satisfied with food, drink, and all the necessities of life.

original: ji ltar shes pa'i gar dang / glu dang / dgod pa dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / gnyen mtshams dang bcas pas kyang mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa'i gar dang / glu dang / dgod pa dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / nye du dang / gnyen mtshams dang bcas pas kyang mchod par bya'o //
translated: They should be worshipped with dance, song, laughter, sons, daughters, friends, relatives, and kinsmen, as one knows how.

original: de la 'dir ni snod dang / snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir ni snod dang / snod ma yin pa brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: Here, one should not examine whether they are worthy or unworthy recipients.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams bde ba chen po rdo rje'i dam tshig 'di dang / 'dod pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rdo rje'i sbyor bas rdo rje chos kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams bde ba chen po rdo rje'i dam tshig 'di dang / 'dod pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rdo rje'i sbyor bas rdo rje chos kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
translated: Because of the great maṇḍala, all sentient beings without exception are sealed with the great bliss vajra pledge, and with the vajra practice that fulfills all wishes, with the equality of vajra dharma.

original: de nas cho ga 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas cho ga 'byung ste /
translated: Then the rite occurs.

original: zla ba nya nas brtsams nas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: zla ba nya nas brtsams nas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Beginning from the full moon, in front of Vajrapāṇi, one should form the very joyful vajra seal,

original: ji ltar skyo bar ma gyur par dang por byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas la rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing ji srid zla ba gcig gi bar de srid du bzlas brjod byas na sngon du bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skyo bar ma gyur par dang por byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas la rdo rje'i tshig gis brjod cing ji srid zla ba gcig gi bar de srid du bzlas brjod byas na sngon du bsnyen pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and without becoming weary, first performing the consecration and so forth, one should recite with vajra speech for as long as one month. If one recites for that long, one will have performed the prior approximation.

original: de nas brtsams te phyag na rdo rje'i bka' ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub thams cad 'grub @103b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te phyag na rdo rje'i bka' ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub thams cad 'grub @103b par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that time on, all powers will be accomplished just as they are taught by Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas ras bris 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: de nas ras bris 'dri ba'am /
translated: Then, if one wishes to draw the cloth painting,

original: 'drir gzhug par 'dod na dang por rdo rje bri ba'i phyag rgyas bris la /
analyzed: 'drir gzhug par 'dod na dang por rdo rje bri ba'i phyag rgyas bris la /
translated: or have it drawn, first draw the vajra with the mudrā of drawing,

original: de'i 'og tu ni ci bder bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni ci bder bya'o //
translated: and then do whatever is comfortable.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad du yang de nyid kyis dang por brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad du yang de nyid kyis dang por brtsam par bya ste /
translated: In all maṇḍalas, one should begin with that.

original: dbus su bcom ldan 'das cho ga ji lta bzhin du bri zhing dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis sems dpa' chen po brgyad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su bcom ldan 'das cho ga ji lta bzhin du bri zhing dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis sems dpa' chen po brgyad bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center, draw the Blessed One according to the rite, and draw the eight great beings according to the method of the great maṇḍala.

original: de nas zla ba nya nas brtsams te phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya nas brtsams te phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
translated: Then, beginning from the full moon, form the great mudrā,

original: de bzhin du sngon du bsnyen pa'i tshul ltar bzlas nas zla ba nya pa'i mtshan mo thog thag ji lta ba bzhin du skyo bar ma gyur pas phyag rgya ma bkrol bar bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du bsnyen pa'i tshul ltar bzlas nas zla ba nya pa'i mtshan mo thog thag ji lta ba bzhin du skyo bar ma gyur pas phyag rgya ma bkrol bar bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: and recite as before according to the method of preliminary service. On the night of the full moon, recite without tiring, without releasing the mudrā.

original: de nas nang par bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal 'dzum zhing zla ba dang mnyam pa'i mdangs can mthong ba stsol cing sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos grub mchog rnams stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nang par bcom ldan 'das kyis zhal 'dzum zhing zla ba dang mnyam pa'i mdangs can mthong ba stsol cing sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la sogs pa'i dngos grub mchog rnams stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then in the morning, the Blessed One will be seen with a smiling face, with a radiance equal to the moon, bestowing sight, and granting the supreme spiritual powers of buddhahood, vajra-holding, and so forth.

original: cho ga gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba dang / phyogs thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / rdo rje 'chang ba thams cad bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po brgyad kyis yongs su bskor ba dang / phyogs thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / rdo rje 'chang ba thams cad bri bar bya'o //
translated: Another ritual: The Blessed One, the Tathagata, surrounded by the eight great Bodhisattvas, and all the Tathagatas and Vajra-holders in all directions, should be drawn.

original: de nas de bzhin du bsgrubs pas sangs rgyas kyi nyid la sogs pa dngos grub thams cad 'grub po //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du bsgrubs pas sangs rgyas kyi nyid la sogs pa dngos grub thams cad 'grub po //
translated: Then, by accomplishing it in the same way, all spiritual powers such as buddhahood and so forth will be attained.

original: ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bsnyems pa dang bcas pa bris la /
analyzed: ras la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bsnyems pa dang bcas pa bris la /
translated: On cloth, draw the Blessed Vajrapani with pride.

original: @104a *// de'i spyan sngar dang po'i phyag rgya chen pos gnas nas bzlas brjod 'bum byas te /
analyzed: @104a *// de'i spyan sngar dang po'i phyag rgya chen pos gnas nas bzlas brjod 'bum byas te /
translated: In front of him, abiding with the great mudra of the first [stage], perform one hundred thousand recitations.

original: 'bum rdzogs na phyag na rdo rje nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum rdzogs na phyag na rdo rje nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one completes one hundred thousand [recitations], one will attain Vajrapāṇi himself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bo gcig pa bris nas yang mthar 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dpa' bo gcig pa bris nas yang mthar 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having drawn the Tathāgata Ekavīra, one will attain buddhahood in the end.

original: de nas bklags pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'i las rnams dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de nas bklags pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'i las rnams dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa tsam gyis 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Next, the activities that are accomplished merely by reciting [the mantra] are accomplished merely by entering the maṇḍala.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba thams cad phul bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba thams cad phul bas so //
translated: In order to please all the tathāgatas, one should offer all the bliss of passion, etc.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po mnyes par bya ba la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'khyud cing 'o byed pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po mnyes par bya ba la ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'khyud cing 'o byed pas so //
translated: In order to please the Great Vajra Holder, one should embrace and kiss Vajrasattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni dpag tu med pa'i bzlas pas so //
translated: In order to please all the bodhisattvas, one should recite [the mantra] immeasurably.

original: rdo rjes thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni rang gi snying po bzlas pas so //
analyzed: rdo rjes thams cad rjes su mnyes par bya ba la ni rang gi snying po bzlas pas so //
translated: In order to please all the vajra [holders], one should recite one's own essence.

original: lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni thams cad du 'bum bzlas pas so //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni thams cad du 'bum bzlas pas so //
translated: For the purpose of pleasing all sentient beings, such as the gods, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: bdag bsrung ba la ni yungs kar la lan gcig bzlas pas so //
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba la ni yungs kar la lan gcig bzlas pas so //
translated: For the purpose of protecting oneself, one should recite the mantra once over white mustard seeds.

original: gzhan bsrung ba la ni rdo rje bskor bas so //
analyzed: gzhan bsrung ba la ni rdo rje bskor bas so //
translated: For the purpose of protecting others, one should circle with the vajra.

original: thams cad bsrung ba la ni yid kyis lan gcig go /
analyzed: thams cad bsrung ba la ni yid kyis lan gcig go /
translated: For the purpose of protecting all, one should do it mentally once.

original: mtshams dang / phyogs dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad bcing ba la ni blta ba'am /
analyzed: mtshams dang / phyogs dang / dkyil 'khor thams cad bcing ba la ni blta ba'am /
translated: For the purpose of binding all boundaries, directions, and maṇḍalas, one should do it with the gaze,

original: @104b yungs kar la sogs pas so //
analyzed: @104b yungs kar la sogs pas so //
translated: or with white mustard seeds, and so on.

original: sems can thams cad rengs par bya ba la ni dbugs mi 'byin par bzlas pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rengs par bya ba la ni dbugs mi 'byin par bzlas pas so //
translated: For the purpose of paralyzing all sentient beings, one should recite without exhaling.

original: sems can thams cad rmugs par bya ba la ni rdo rje btsir bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rmugs par bya ba la ni rdo rje btsir bas so //
translated: For the purpose of stupefying all sentient beings, one should press the vajra.

original: sems can thams cad rmongs par bya ba la ni mig btsum nas bzlas pas so //🔽thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje bral bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rmongs par bya ba la ni mig btsum nas bzlas pas so // thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje bral bas so //
translated: For the purpose of deluding all sentient beings, one should recite with closed eyes.🔽For the purpose of killing all, one should do it with the vajra separation.

original: sems can thams cad rgyas gdab pa la ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad rgyas gdab pa la ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the purpose of sealing all sentient beings, one should do it with the mudrā of Vajraḍāka.

original: snying thams cad 'dren cing 'byin pa la ni yid kyis bzlas pas so //
analyzed: snying thams cad 'dren cing 'byin pa la ni yid kyis bzlas pas so //
translated: For drawing out and ejecting all hearts, one should recite mentally.

original: sems can thams cad za ba la ni ldang zhing myur bas zlos pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad za ba la ni ldang zhing myur bas zlos pas so //
translated: For devouring all sentient beings, one should recite standing up and quickly.

original: sems can thams cad skrag par bya ba la ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skrag par bya ba la ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For terrifying all sentient beings, one should use the mudrā of Vajrabhairava.

original: nor thams cad dgug pa la ni gser gyis bzlas pas so //
analyzed: nor thams cad dgug pa la ni gser gyis bzlas pas so //
translated: For summoning all wealth, one should recite with gold.

original: nor dang / 'bru thams cad dgug pa la ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru thams cad dgug pa la ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For summoning all wealth and grain, one should use the mudrā of Vajrayoginī.

original: thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni pi wang brdung ba dang bcas pa'i ka ka la'i glu len pas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni pi wang brdung ba dang bcas pa'i ka ka la'i glu len pas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For making all beings passionate, one should recite with the singing of the Kakā melody accompanied by playing the vīṇā.

original: thams cad 'bigs pa dang / rjes su chags par bya ba la ni rdo rje mda'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: thams cad 'bigs pa dang / rjes su chags par bya ba la ni rdo rje mda'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For piercing and captivating all, one should use the mudrā of the vajra arrow.

original: thams cad chags par bya ba la ni phyogs thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes pas so //
analyzed: thams cad chags par bya ba la ni phyogs thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mnyes pas so //
translated: For captivating all, one should please the tathāgatas in all directions.

original: gdug pa'i 'ching ba brtan par bya ba la ni snying brtan por nges par 'tshir bas so //
analyzed: gdug pa'i 'ching ba brtan par bya ba la ni snying brtan por nges par 'tshir bas so //
translated: For binding the wicked firmly, it is by firmly pressing the heart.

original: ma rungs pa rab tu bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje @105a *//
analyzed: ma rungs pa rab tu bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje @105a *//
translated: For subduing the wicked, it is by the vajra

original: bsnyems pas so //
analyzed: bsnyems pas so //
translated: arrogance.🔽For stealing all ornaments, it is by stealing with the blazing

original: rgyan thams cad dbrog pa la ni 'bar ba'i blta bas dbrog pas so //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad dbrog pa la ni 'bar ba'i blta bas dbrog pas so //
translated: gaze.

original: thams cad yid tshim pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur snying khar bzhag pas so //
analyzed: thams cad yid tshim pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur snying khar bzhag pas so //
translated: For satisfying everyone, it is by placing the vajra fist on the🔽heart.

original: mun pa snang bar bya ba la ni rdo rje kha shar du bltas te bskor bas so //
analyzed: mun pa snang bar bya ba la ni rdo rje kha shar du bltas te bskor bas so //
translated: For illuminating darkness, it is by turning the vajra to the east.

original: lus bde bar bya ba la ni rang gi mtshan gyi bzlas pas so //
analyzed: lus bde bar bya ba la ni rang gi mtshan gyi bzlas pas so //
translated: For bodily bliss, it is by reciting one’s name.🔽For illuminating all forms, it is by the mudra of the supreme vajra

original: gzugs thams cad snang bar bya ba la ni rdo rje gzugs kyi mchog gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad snang bar bya ba la ni rdo rje gzugs kyi mchog gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: form.

original: sgra thams cad thos par bya ba la ni rdo rje pi wang gis so //
analyzed: sgra thams cad thos par bya ba la ni rdo rje pi wang gis so //
translated: For hearing all sounds, it is by the vajra lute.🔽For the various sweet smells, it is by the song of exhaling through

original: dri zhim po sna tshogs pa'i phyir ni sna'i dbugs 'byin pa'i glu yis so //
analyzed: dri zhim po sna tshogs pa'i phyir ni sna'i dbugs 'byin pa'i glu yis so //
translated: the nose.

original: zas dang / skom thams cad dang / bcud thams cad spo ba la ni rdo rje spo bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas dang / skom thams cad dang / bcud thams cad spo ba la ni rdo rje spo bar bya'o //
translated: For the transference of all food, drink, and essences, use the Vajra Transference.

original: dbab pa thams cad la ni mnyam pa'i thal mo dang / se gol dang / glu'i bzlas pas so //🔽thams cad gar byed du gzhug pa la bdag nyid gar byed cing bzlas pas so //
analyzed: dbab pa thams cad la ni mnyam pa'i thal mo dang / se gol dang / glu'i bzlas pas so // thams cad gar byed du gzhug pa la bdag nyid gar byed cing bzlas pas so //
translated: For all descents, use the even palms, the snapping of fingers, and the mantra recitation of song.🔽For making all dance, use the dance and mantra recitation of oneself.

original: thams cad glu len du gzhug pa la ni lce bskyod cing bzlas pas so //
analyzed: thams cad glu len du gzhug pa la ni lce bskyod cing bzlas pas so //
translated: For making all sing, use the mantra recitation with the vibrating tongue.

original: thams cad smrar gzhug pa la ni rdo rje ma chu yis so //
analyzed: thams cad smrar gzhug pa la ni rdo rje ma chu yis so //
translated: For making all speak, use the Vajra Lady water.

original: thams cad babs nas lan ston pa la ni rdo rje 'bebs pas so //
analyzed: thams cad babs nas lan ston pa la ni rdo rje 'bebs pas so //
translated: For making all descend and give replies, use the Vajra Descent.

original: gdon thams cad las thar bar bya ba la ni rdo rje myu gu'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: gdon thams cad las thar bar bya ba la ni rdo rje myu gu'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For freeing from all grahas, use the Vajra Sprout seal.

original: gdon thams cad 'dzin du gzhug pa @105b la ni tshogs kyi bdag po rab tu dga' ba'i khro bos bzlas pas so //
analyzed: gdon thams cad 'dzin du gzhug pa @105b la ni tshogs kyi bdag po rab tu dga' ba'i khro bos bzlas pas so //
translated: For binding all grahas, use the mantra recitation of the very wrathful lord of the gaṇas.

original: rims nad thams cad 'dzin du gzhug pa la ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi gdon gyis so //
analyzed: rims nad thams cad 'dzin du gzhug pa la ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi gdon gyis so //
translated: For binding all fevers, use the graha of the Vajra Family.

original: rims thams cad bsal ba la ni rdo rje'i lta bas bsal bas so //
analyzed: rims thams cad bsal ba la ni rdo rje'i lta bas bsal bas so //
translated: For the removal of all fevers, remove with the vajra gaze.

original: dug thams cad sbar ba la ni rdo rje lta ba'i dug gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dug thams cad sbar ba la ni rdo rje lta ba'i dug gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the burning of all poisons, with the poison-vajra gaze.

original: dug thams cad gzhig pa la ni rma bya'i chun bos so //
analyzed: dug thams cad gzhig pa la ni rma bya'i chun bos so //
translated: For the destruction of all poisons, with the peacock feather.

original: dug thams cad bza' ba la ni rdo rje bdud rtsi'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dug thams cad bza' ba la ni rdo rje bdud rtsi'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the eating of all poisons, with the vajra nectar seal.

original: bdud la sogs pa ma rungs pa thams cad brlag pa la ni 'khrugs pas dpag tu med par bzlas pas so //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa ma rungs pa thams cad brlag pa la ni 'khrugs pas dpag tu med par bzlas pas so //
translated: For the destruction of all evil such as Mara, recite the immeasurable wrathful one.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i gdon thams cad las grol bar bya ba la ni rdo rje chen po gsor ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i gdon thams cad las grol bar bya ba la ni rdo rje chen po gsor ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the liberation from all dakini spirit possessions, with the great vajra-darting seal.

original: phyag rgya thams cad gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'phen pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'phen pas so //
translated: For the destruction of all seals, with the vajra-darting.

original: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / gdul ba la ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga'i phyag rgya 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / gdul ba la ni rdo rje kha tv'am ga'i phyag rgya 'dzin pas so //
translated: For summoning, inducting, and disciplining all dakinis, hold the vajra khaṭvāṅga seal.

original: ma mo thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa dang / gsang ba gzhig pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i yi ge phat kyis so //
analyzed: ma mo thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dam tshig dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang / rig pa dang / gsang ba gzhig pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i yi ge phat kyis so //
translated: For the maṇḍala of all mātṛkā, and for the samaya, essence, mudrā, mantra, vidyā, and secret of all mātṛkā, it is with the vajra wrathful syllable PHAṬ.

original: ma mo dang / mkha' 'gro ma thams cad mngag gzhug par bya ba la ni ma mo'i gnas su khros pas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: ma mo dang / mkha' 'gro ma thams cad mngag gzhug par bya ba la ni ma mo'i gnas su khros pas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: For summoning all mātṛkā and ḍākinī, one should recite one hundred thousand times in the abode of the mātṛkā with wrath.

original: bdud thams cad kyi stobs gzhom pa la ni rdo rje drag po'i ha ha zhes bya ba'i gad rgyangs kyis so //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyi stobs gzhom pa la ni rdo rje drag po'i ha ha zhes bya ba'i gad rgyangs kyis so //
translated: For destroying the power of all māras, it is with the vajra fierce HA HA laughter.

original: @106a *// gzhan gyi dpung thams cad gzhom pa la ni rdo rje la yongs su bzlas la 'phang ngo //
analyzed: @106a *// gzhan gyi dpung thams cad gzhom pa la ni rdo rje la yongs su bzlas la 'phang ngo //
translated: For destroying all other armies, one should recite over a sling and hurl it.

original: 'thab pa thams cad las thar bar bya ba la ni rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: 'thab pa thams cad las thar bar bya ba la ni rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For liberation from all battles, it is with the vajra victory banner mudrā.

original: thams cad bcing ba la ni gos la mdud pa bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad bcing ba la ni gos la mdud pa bya'o //
translated: For binding all, one should tie a knot in one’s garment.

original: thams cad dgrol ba la ni yi ge mu yis so //
analyzed: thams cad dgrol ba la ni yi ge mu yis so //
translated: For releasing all, it is with the syllable MU.

original: ro langs dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyis so //
analyzed: ro langs dang / 'khrul 'khor thams cad gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'jigs byed kyis so //
translated: For destroying all zombies and magical devices, use Vajrabhairava.

original: lcags sgrog thams cad dgrol ba la ni rdo rje khab long gis so //
analyzed: lcags sgrog thams cad dgrol ba la ni rdo rje khab long gis so //
translated: For releasing all fetters, use Vajra Magnet.

original: me yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rdo rje me shel gyis so //
analyzed: me yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rdo rje me shel gyis so //
translated: For producing fire, use Vajra Fire Crystal.

original: chu med par chu yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rdo rje chu shel gyis so //
analyzed: chu med par chu yang dag par bskyed pa la ni rdo rje chu shel gyis so //
translated: For producing water without water, use Vajra Water Crystal.

original: nam mkha' las zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / rgyan thams cad la sogs pa yo byad mang po 'byung ba la ni nam mkha' la lta zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / rgyan thams cad la sogs pa yo byad mang po 'byung ba la ni nam mkha' la lta zhing bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: For the appearance of many articles such as food, drink, clothes, ornaments, and so on, from the sky, look at the sky and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: nam mkha' las sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa gzugs thams cad ston pa la ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran la nam mkhar lta zhing bzlas pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' las sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa gzugs thams cad ston pa la ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran la nam mkhar lta zhing bzlas pas so //
translated: For the display of all forms such as the body of the Buddha and so on in the sky, recite the mantra while recollecting the Buddha and looking at the sky.

original: nam mkha' las yi ges 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lung bsgo ba bden par ston pa la ni yi ge aa bris la bzlas brjod 'bum byas pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' las yi ges 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lung bsgo ba bden par ston pa la ni yi ge aa bris la bzlas brjod 'bum byas pas so //
translated: For revealing the truth of the prediction of the past, future, and present, write the syllable A and do the recitation one hundred thousand times.

original: pra se na thams cad las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lung bsgo @106b ba bden par ston pa la ni rdo rje pra se na thams cad dbab pas so //
analyzed: pra se na thams cad las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i lung bsgo @106b ba bden par ston pa la ni rdo rje pra se na thams cad dbab pas so //
translated: For revealing the truth of the prediction of all the past, future, and present prasenā, do the descent of all vajra prasenā.

original: de bzhin du mig gis bden pa thams cad mthong ba la ni rang gi mig la bzlas pa 'bum byas pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gis bden pa thams cad mthong ba la ni rang gi mig la bzlas pa 'bum byas pas so //
translated: Similarly, for seeing all truths with the eye, do the recitation one hundred thousand times on one’s own eye.

original: rna bas thos par bya ba la ni rang gi rna ba la bzlas pa 'bum byas pas so //🔽rnas mnam par bya ba la ni sna la bzlas pas so //
analyzed: rna bas thos par bya ba la ni rang gi rna ba la bzlas pa 'bum byas pas so // rnas mnam par bya ba la ni sna la bzlas pas so //
translated: For hearing with the ear, do the recitation one hundred thousand times on one’s own ear.🔽For smelling with the nose, do the recitation on the nose.

original: lces rang nyid smra ba la ni lce la bzlas pas so //
analyzed: lces rang nyid smra ba la ni lce la bzlas pas so //
translated: For speaking with the tongue, do the recitation on the tongue.

original: lus kyis reg par bya ba la ni lus la bzlas pas so //
analyzed: lus kyis reg par bya ba la ni lus la bzlas pas so //
translated: For touching with the body, do the recitation on the body.

original: yid kyis shes par bya ba la ni yid la 'bum bzlas pas so //
analyzed: yid kyis shes par bya ba la ni yid la 'bum bzlas pas so //
translated: For knowing with the mind, do the recitation on the mind one hundred thousand times.

original: rmad du byung ba thams cad bstan pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi sku bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba thams cad bstan pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi sku bsgrubs pas so //
translated: For the display of all miracles, by accomplishing the Buddha’s body.

original: sgyu ma thams cad bstan pa la ni rma bya'i sgro'i chun po la 'bum bzlas pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma thams cad bstan pa la ni rma bya'i sgro'i chun po la 'bum bzlas pas so //
translated: For the display of all illusions, by reciting a hundred thousand times into a peacock’s feather.

original: thams cad g-yog par bya ba la ni zhi ba'i gnas su 'bum bzlas pas so //🔽thams cad la lan ldon par bya ba la ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rdo rjes so //
analyzed: thams cad g-yog par bya ba la ni zhi ba'i gnas su 'bum bzlas pas so // thams cad la lan ldon par bya ba la ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rdo rjes so //
translated: For the subjugation of all, by reciting a hundred thousand times in a place of peace.🔽For the repayment of all, with the vajra of Vajrahūṃkāra.

original: rdzu 'phrul thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje rdzu 'phrul gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje rdzu 'phrul gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the display of all miracles, with the vajra miracle gesture.

original: cho 'phrul thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: cho 'phrul thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the display of all wonders, with the vajra concentration gesture.

original: rang gi lus la sogs pa dngos po thams cad las sangs rgyas dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pas so //
analyzed: rang gi lus la sogs pa dngos po thams cad las sangs rgyas dang / rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rgyu ba dang / mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad bstan pa la ni rdo rje rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pas so //
translated: For the display of all things, such as one’s own body, and all things, moving and unmoving, such as the Buddhas, Vajrasattva, and so on, with the emanation of vajra miracles.

original: lha thams cad dbab pa la ni rdo rje bskor bas @107a *//
analyzed: lha thams cad dbab pa la ni rdo rje bskor bas @107a *//
translated: For the descent of all deities, one should rotate the vajra.

original: so // klu thams cad rjes su 'brang bar bya ba la ni klu'i rgyal po'i mtshor bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: so // klu thams cad rjes su 'brang bar bya ba la ni klu'i rgyal po'i mtshor bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For the service of all nāgas, one should recite in a lake of the king of nāgas.

original: gnod sbyin thams cad mngag gzhug par bya ba la ni rdo rje'i bka' bsgo bas so //
analyzed: gnod sbyin thams cad mngag gzhug par bya ba la ni rdo rje'i bka' bsgo bas so //
translated: For the employment of all yakṣas, one should give the vajra command.

original: 'byung po thams cad gdul ba la ni lha chen po mnan nas khros pas bzlas brjod bya'o //🔽ser ba thams cad bzlog pa la ni rdo rje srid srung gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad gdul ba la ni lha chen po mnan nas khros pas bzlas brjod bya'o // ser ba thams cad bzlog pa la ni rdo rje srid srung gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the subjugation of all bhūtas, one should recite with the wrathful suppression of the great gods.🔽For averting all hailstorms, one should use the mudrā of Vajra Rakṣa.

original: glog 'bab pa thams cad bzlog pa la ni rdo rje khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: glog 'bab pa thams cad bzlog pa la ni rdo rje khro gnyer can gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For averting all lightning strikes, one should use the mudrā of Vajra Bhṛkuṭi.

original: char dbab pa la ni klu'i mtshor bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: char dbab pa la ni klu'i mtshor bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For causing rain, one should recite in a lake of nāgas.

original: char gcad pa la ni dri ma med pa'i chu'i sbyin blug bya'o //
analyzed: char gcad pa la ni dri ma med pa'i chu'i sbyin blug bya'o //
translated: For stopping rain, one should offer a water oblation free from impurities.

original: sprin bskyed pa la ni klu bris nas bdug pas bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: sprin bskyed pa la ni klu bris nas bdug pas bdug par bya'o //
translated: For producing clouds, one should draw a nāga and fumigate it with incense.

original: sprin bshig pa la ni rdo rje nam mkha'i sprin gyis so //
analyzed: sprin bshig pa la ni rdo rje nam mkha'i sprin gyis so //
translated: For dispersing clouds, one should use Vajra Ākāśa-megha.

original: chu med pa'i phyogs su shin tu bsil ba'i chu'i tshogs rtag tu 'byung ba la ni rdo rje klu'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: chu med pa'i phyogs su shin tu bsil ba'i chu'i tshogs rtag tu 'byung ba la ni rdo rje klu'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the constant arising of a mass of very cool water in a place without water, use the mudra of the vajra naga.

original: gter thams cad shes par bya ba la ni snod du chu blug par bya'o //🔽gter thams cad brko ba la ni rdo rje 'jor gyis so //
analyzed: gter thams cad shes par bya ba la ni snod du chu blug par bya'o // gter thams cad brko ba la ni rdo rje 'jor gyis so //
translated: For the knowledge of all treasures, fill a vessel with water.🔽For the digging of all treasures, use the vajra spade.

original: gter thams cad rnyed pa la ni rdo rje nor gyis so //
analyzed: gter thams cad rnyed pa la ni rdo rje nor gyis so //
translated: For the discovery of all treasures, use the vajra treasure.

original: rgyal srid thams cad thob par bya ba la ni rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: rgyal srid thams cad thob par bya ba la ni rdo rje dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the attainment of all kingdoms, use the mudra of the vajra consecration.

original: sa'i bdag por bya ba la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: sa'i bdag por bya ba la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the lordship of the earth, use the mudra of the consecration of Vajrasattva.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje @107b 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje @107b 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all mandalas, use the vajra wheel mudra.

original: phyag rgya thams cad bsgrub pa la ni bde ba chen po'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad bsgrub pa la ni bde ba chen po'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all mudras, use the mudra of the commitment of great bliss.

original: dam tshig thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dam tshig thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all commitments, use the mudra of the vajra joy.

original: dngos grub thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje snyems pa'i lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje snyems pa'i lcags kyu'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all powers, use the hook gesture of Vajragarva.

original: ma grub pa thams cad grub par ston pa la ni rdo rje grub pa'i phyag rgyas so //🔽rdo rje rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje rig pa 'dzin pa'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: ma grub pa thams cad grub par ston pa la ni rdo rje grub pa'i phyag rgyas so // rdo rje rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje rig pa 'dzin pa'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the teaching of all that is not accomplished, use the gesture of Vajrasiddhi.🔽For the accomplishment of all vajra knowledge holders, use the gesture of the vajra knowledge holder.

original: rdo rje thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje thams cad kyi mchog gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: rdo rje thams cad bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje thams cad kyi mchog gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all vajras, use the gesture of the supreme of all vajras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bsgrub pa la ni thugs kyi rdo rjes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bsgrub pa la ni thugs kyi rdo rjes so //
translated: For the accomplishment of all bodhisattvas, use the mind vajra.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen pos so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen pos so //
translated: For the accomplishment of the state of Vajradhara, use the great seal of Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje ye shes kyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid bsgrub pa la ni rdo rje ye shes kyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the accomplishment of buddhahood, use the vajra wisdom seal.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig thams cad kyi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig thams cad kyi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the great king of tantras, the Great King of Manifestations of Mahāsukha Vajragītā.

original: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje zhes bya ba rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid rdo rje zhes bya ba rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: The great samaya, the great reality, the great king of tantras called Vajra, is complete.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rtog pa'o ////
translated: This is the tantra of Vajrasattva.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vairocana,

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhi ba'i chos nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di gsungs te /🔽rdo rje sra @108a *//🔽ba nyid kyi phyir rdo rje mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhi ba'i chos nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di gsungs te / rdo rje sra @108a *// ba nyid kyi phyir rdo rje mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
translated: again taught this method of the perfection of wisdom called “The Attainment of the Manifest Complete Awakening to the Reality of Peace of All Tathāgatas”:🔽“The vajra-like firmness is the great awakening.🔽The manifest complete awakening to the sameness of vajra is the great awakening.

original: don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir don gyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir don gyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
translated: The manifest complete awakening to the sameness of meaning is the great awakening, because of the oneness of meaning.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
translated: The realization of the sameness of all phenomena is great enlightenment, because of the purity of the very essence of phenomena.

original: thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad mnyam pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni byang chub chen po'o //
translated: The realization of the sameness of all things is great enlightenment, because of the non-conceptuality of all things.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: gang la la chos mngon par bsgrub pa bzhi po 'di dag nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de sdig pa thams cad spyod kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la la chos mngon par bsgrub pa bzhi po 'di dag nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de sdig pa thams cad spyod kyang byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: anyone who listens to, upholds, reads, and meditates on these four realizations of the Abhidharma will transcend all evil destinies until they reach the site of enlightenment, even if they engage in all sorts of evil.

original: de nas de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de nas de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Then, having said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi khu tshur yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyi gnas 'dir nyid rgya cher ston cing bzhin 'dzum pa dang bcas te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi snying po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ye shes kyi khu tshur yongs su 'dzin pa'i don gyi gnas 'dir nyid rgya cher ston cing bzhin 'dzum pa dang bcas te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi snying po 'di gsungs so //
translated: He spoke this essence of the sameness of all phenomena:🔽Aḥ.

original: aa:/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par 'dus par mdzad nas /
analyzed: aa:/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par 'dus par mdzad nas /
translated: As soon as he spoke this, all the tathāgatas gathered together.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs thams cad du rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil @108b 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa dang / sems dpa' chen po brgyad phyi'i dkyil 'khor du phyogs brgyad du bzhad pa chen pos bzhad cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs thams cad du rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil @108b 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa dang / sems dpa' chen po brgyad phyi'i dkyil 'khor du phyogs brgyad du bzhad pa chen pos bzhad cing bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One remained in all directions in the manner of the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, and the eight great beings remained in the outer maṇḍala, laughing with great laughter in the eight directions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rdo
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rdo
translated: Then the bhagavat tathagata Vairochana entered the samadhi called the tathagata empowerment of the vajra mandala and said this to all tathagatas:🔽“Om, all tathagatas, please empower me.”🔽

original: rje zhes bya ba'i dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: rje zhes bya ba'i dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Vairocana, entered the samādhi called “The Empowerment of the Vajra Maṇḍala of All Tathāgatas,” and taught this great maṇḍala of the Great Vow called “The Vajra of the Reality of All Tathāgatas.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
translated: In the manner of the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, draw the outer maṇḍala.

original: de'i dbus su thig gsum gyi 'khor lo bris nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad kar sna tshogs padmar rab tu gnas pa de'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa chen po sa la sogs pa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su thig gsum gyi 'khor lo bris nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thad kar sna tshogs padmar rab tu gnas pa de'i 'khor lo'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa chen po sa la sogs pa las byas pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In its center, draw a wheel with three spokes, and in front of the Blessed One, well-established on a variegated lotus, in the center of that wheel, place the Blessed One, the Great Tathāgata, made of earth or other materials.

original: de'i phyogs thams cad du sa la sogs pa las byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad gzhag gam bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs thams cad du sa la sogs pa las byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa brgyad gzhag gam bri bar bya'o //
translated: In all directions of that [maṇḍala], one should place or draw the eight tathāgatas made of earth and so forth.

original: de nas tshon gyi thig le rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //🔽phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs bzhi dang / mtshams rnams su byang chub sems dpa' @109a *//
analyzed: de nas tshon gyi thig le rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o // phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs bzhi dang / mtshams rnams su byang chub sems dpa' @109a *//
translated: Then, in the maṇḍala wheel of the drops of color, one should draw the tathāgatas residing there together with the vajra-holder.🔽In the four directions and intermediate directions of the outer maṇḍala, one should place the eight bodhisattvas as appropriate.

original: brgyad ci lta ba bzhin bzhag nas bum pa gang ba bzhi sgo rnams su dgod par bya zhing /
analyzed: brgyad ci lta ba bzhin bzhag nas bum pa gang ba bzhi sgo rnams su dgod par bya zhing /
translated: Having placed the four filled vases at the gates,

original: byang chub kyi mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya ste /
translated: one should place the signs of enlightenment.

original: shar nas brtsams te ne'u gsings dang bcas pa'i dum bu dang / ro drug gis yongs su gang zhing dbyig dang / gser dang / rin po che dang / gos la sogs pas yongs su bkang ba'i snod dang / 'jam zhing shin tu bde ba'i stan dang /
analyzed: shar nas brtsams te ne'u gsings dang bcas pa'i dum bu dang / ro drug gis yongs su gang zhing dbyig dang / gser dang / rin po che dang / gos la sogs pas yongs su bkang ba'i snod dang / 'jam zhing shin tu bde ba'i stan dang /
translated: Beginning from the east, one should place a piece of ground with grass, a vessel filled with the six flavors, a vessel filled with jewels, gold, precious substances, cloth, and so forth, a soft and very comfortable seat,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dgod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dgod do //
translated: and install the image of the Buddha.

original: de nas de bzhin du gos gyon la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas zhugs na /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gos gyon la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcings nas zhugs na /
translated: Then, having dressed in the same way, and having entered, binding the vajra-bond of all the Tathagatas,

original: bdag nyid slob dpon med par yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid slob dpon med par yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis rlob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will be consecrated by the Blessed One, the consecration of all the Tathagatas, even without a master.

original: de nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa dang / dngos grub thams cad la mi tshugs pa dang / mi sod pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa dang / dngos grub thams cad la mi tshugs pa dang / mi sod pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that time on, one will obtain the realization of all the Tathagatas, and all powers, invulnerable, invincible, and free from all obscurations.

original: de nas slob ma yang de bzhin du gzhug go /
analyzed: de nas slob ma yang de bzhin du gzhug go /
translated: Then, one should cause the disciple to enter in the same way.

original: zhugs nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa byin la rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba yang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa byin la rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur ba yang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having entered, one should give him the five-pointed vajra, and also confer the empowerment of the vajra name.

original: de nas dam tshig 'di dag bya bar bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig 'di dag bya bar bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should command him to perform these commitments:

original: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bstan pa thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bstan pa thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of benefiting all beings, and for the sake of protecting all the teachings,

original: rnam par mi rtog @109b sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog @109b sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of non-conceptuality,

original: ci bde bar ni thams cad kyis //
analyzed: ci bde bar ni thams cad kyis //
translated: all should be given as much as possible.

original: zhes bya'o // de nas mtshan ma bzhi 'byor pa ji lta bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nas mtshan ma bzhi 'byor pa ji lta bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, according to one's fortune, one should give the four symbols.

original: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of the Great Commitment.

original: de nas sgrub pa ni ras la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'dzum pa dang bcas shing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur gyi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa ni ras la bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'dzum pa dang bcas shing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur gyi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: Next, the accomplishment: on a cloth one should paint the Blessed Vairocana with a smile, holding the mudra of the fist of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bya'o //
translated: All others should be done in the manner of the mandala of the Great Commitment.

analyzed: de nas de bzhin du sems dpa' mchog sgrub pa dang / dngos grub mchog rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Then, the accomplishment of the supreme being is just like that, and the supreme accomplishments are also like that.

original: gzhan yang ras la bcom ldan 'das dpa' bo gcig pu bris te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ras la bcom ldan 'das dpa' bo gcig pu bris te /
translated: Furthermore, on a cloth one should paint the Blessed Solitary Hero.

original: 'di'i mdun du rdo rje'i tshig gis bzlas brjod 'bum byas nas ye shes kyi khu tshur yongs su 'dzin pas mtshan mo thog thag bzlas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob cing dngos grub grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i mdun du rdo rje'i tshig gis bzlas brjod 'bum byas nas ye shes kyi khu tshur yongs su 'dzin pas mtshan mo thog thag bzlas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob cing dngos grub grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'gyur la /
translated: In front of this, having recited the vajra words one hundred thousand times, if one recites all night long with the complete retention of the wisdom fist, one will attain the perfection of wisdom and become a bodhisattva who has accomplished the powers.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //

translated: One should know that the perfection of wisdom is free from conceptual elaborations due to the absence of conceptual elaborations in all phenomena.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa des 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir khams gsum du skyes pa'i sems can thams cad bsad kyang ngan song gi skye bar mi 'gyur te /

translated: if someone listens to, upholds, reads, and meditates on this method of the perfection of wisdom, even if they kill all sentient beings born in the three realms for the sake of taming them, they will not be reborn in the lower realms,

analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje chos nyid 'di'i don rgya cher ston cing /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje chos nyid 'di'i don rgya cher ston cing /
translated: Then the Blessed One, teaching extensively the meaning of this Dharma,🔽bound the mudrā called the vajra of victory over the three worlds,

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya bcings la /

analyzed: khro gnyer dang bcas shing smin ma bteg ste 'bar bar blta la padma'i gdong khro zhing dgod de /
translated: With a frown, raising his eyebrows, he looked blazingly, with a lotus face, wrathful and laughing,

original: mche ba gtsigs nas rkang pa g-yas pa bskum pa'i tshul @111a *//
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs nas rkang pa g-yas pa bskum pa'i tshul @111a *//
translated: baring his fangs, standing with his right leg bent,

original: gnas pas gnas nas /
analyzed: gnas pas gnas nas /
translated: he abided.🔽He spoke this essence, “vajra hūṃ.”

original: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs so //🔽h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po rnams yang dag par bkug ste lhung bar mdzad nas dkyil 'khor du bcug nas rnam par rgyal bar mdzad bcings te dbang du
analyzed: rdo rje h'um zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs so // h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po rnams yang dag par bkug ste lhung bar mdzad nas dkyil 'khor du bcug nas rnam par rgyal bar mdzad bcings te dbang du
translated: Hūṃ.🔽Then, as soon as he spoke this, all the lords of the three worlds, such as Śiva, were summoned, fell, were brought into the maṇḍala, were made victorious, were bound,

original: byas nas btul zhing rjes su btul te bslang nas yang dam tshig gis bcings nas 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dbang phyug chen po chung ma dang bcas pa zhabs gnyis su phab nas mnan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: byas nas btul zhing rjes su btul te bslang nas yang dam tshig gis bcings nas 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag po dbang phyug chen po chung ma dang bcas pa zhabs gnyis su phab nas mnan pa mdzad do //
translated: were subdued, were completely subdued, were raised up, were bound by pledge, and the lords of the three worlds, with the great lord Śiva and his wife, were placed under his feet and pressed down.

original: de nas de rnams kyis 'jig rten gsum po thams cad du sgra chen po bsgrags te /
