analyzed: lus ngan po mnan nas dpal dbrog par bya ba la ni rdo rje skyes bus so //
translated: For pressing down on Kubera and robbing him of his glory, one should use the Vajra Man.

original: 'dod pa'i lha dbang du bya ba la ni 'dod pa'i lha'i mdun du khros pas bzlas brjod bya'o //🔽tshangs pa ltung bar bya ba la ni rdo rje rab tu dga' ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha dbang du bya ba la ni 'dod pa'i lha'i mdun du khros pas bzlas brjod bya'o // tshangs pa ltung bar bya ba la ni rdo rje rab tu dga' ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For bringing the celestial gods under one's control, one should recite wrathfully in front of the celestial gods.🔽For causing Brahmā to fall, one should use the Vajra Joyful Mudrā.

original: khyab 'jug gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'khor lo dral bas so //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gzhig pa la ni rdo rje 'khor lo dral bas so //
translated: For destroying Viṣṇu, one should use the Vajra Wheel-Striking.

original: dbang phyug chen po 'dul bar bya ba la ni rdo rje tri sh'u dral bas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po 'dul bar bya ba la ni rdo rje tri sh'u dral bas so //
translated: For taming Maheśvara, one should use the Vajra Triśūla-Striking.

original: ma mo thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i tshogs kyi srin mos so //
analyzed: ma mo thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i tshogs kyi srin mos so //
translated: For killing all the mātṛs, one should use the Vajra Wrathful Assembly Rākṣasī.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig dang / chos dang / gsang ba'i dngos grub rnam par gtor zhing rnam par gzhig pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i gdug pa'i dam tshig 'jigs par byed pas so //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi phyag rgya dang / dam tshig dang / chos dang / gsang ba'i dngos grub rnam par gtor zhing rnam par gzhig pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i gdug pa'i dam tshig 'jigs par byed pas so //
translated: For the destruction and dispersal of all external maṇḍalas, mudrās, samayas, dharmas, and secret siddhis, [use] the terrifying samaya of Vajrakrodha.

original: ri dang / shing dang / khyim dang / gtsug lag khang dang / grong khyer dang / mchod rten dang / lha'i khang pa dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / glang po dang bcas pa'i rta la sogs pa thams cad gzhom pa @114b la ni rdo rje khro ba'i lha bas mig la reg pas so //🔽ltung ba thams cad bslang ba la ni rdo rje khro bo bslang bas so //
analyzed: ri dang / shing dang / khyim dang / gtsug lag khang dang / grong khyer dang / mchod rten dang / lha'i khang pa dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / glang po dang bcas pa'i rta la sogs pa thams cad gzhom pa @114b la ni rdo rje khro ba'i lha bas mig la reg pas so // ltung ba thams cad bslang ba la ni rdo rje khro bo bslang bas so //
translated: For the destruction of all mountains, trees, houses, temples, cities, stūpas, temples of deities, men, women, elephants, horses, and so forth, [use] the Vajrakrodha-deity-eye-touch.🔽For the lifting of all downfalls, [use] the Vajrakrodha-lifting.

original: thams cad spo ba la ni rdo rje khros pa'i rnal 'byor mas so; ;thams cad dbrog pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i khu tshur dang / dbrog pas so //
analyzed: thams cad spo ba la ni rdo rje khros pa'i rnal 'byor mas so; ;thams cad dbrog pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i khu tshur dang / dbrog pas so //
translated: For the transference of all, [use] the Vajrakrodha-yoginī. For the robbing of all, [use] the Vajrakrodha-fist and robbing.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad bskyed pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas so //🔽dpung thams cad bsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i gnod sbyin mos so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad bskyed pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas so // dpung thams cad bsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo'i gnod sbyin mos so //
translated: For generating all fears, [use] the gaze of Vajra Wrath.🔽For killing all armies, [use] the wrathful yakṣiṇī of Vajra Wrath.

original: gzhan gyi dpung thams cad gzhom pa dang / gnon pa dang / rmongs par bya ba dang / long bar bya ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang; bsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo ma rungs pa'i srin mos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dpung thams cad gzhom pa dang / gnon pa dang / rmongs par bya ba dang / long bar bya ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang; bsad pa la ni rdo rje khro bo ma rungs pa'i srin mos so //
translated: For destroying, suppressing, confusing, blinding, sealing, and killing all armies of others, [use] the fierce rākṣasī of Vajra Wrath.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa mi chen po thams cad gsad pa la ni dong ka'i shing la rang gi khrag gis sbyin sreg byas pas so //🔽lha thams cad rnam par gzhig pa la ni lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab pas so //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa mi chen po thams cad gsad pa la ni dong ka'i shing la rang gi khrag gis sbyin sreg byas pas so // lha thams cad rnam par gzhig pa la ni lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab pas so //
translated: For killing all great people such as kings, [use] oblations of your own blood in a dongka tree.🔽For destroying all gods, [use] stabbing effigies of all gods with a kīla.

original: lha'i bdag po thams cad bsreg pa la ni lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi yam shing gis so //
analyzed: lha'i bdag po thams cad bsreg pa la ni lha thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan gyi yam shing gis so //
translated: For burning all lords of gods, [use] kindling effigies of all gods.

original: rang gi khrag gi rgyun 'bab pas sa thams cad nub par bya ba la ni rdo rje 'khro bo sa 'og gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: rang gi khrag gi rgyun 'bab pas sa thams cad nub par bya ba la ni rdo rje 'khro bo sa 'og gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the purpose of causing all the earth to sink by the flow of one’s own blood, [use] the mudra of Vajra Aṅkuśa Pātālī.

original: khams gsum thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje 'jig pa'i phyag rgyas so //🔽'jig rten gsum po thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba la ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par @115a *//
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad gsad pa la ni rdo rje 'jig pa'i phyag rgyas so // 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba la ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par @115a *//
translated: For the purpose of killing all the three realms, [use] the mudra of Vajra Bhikṣa.

original: rgyal ba'i mchog gi rdo rje'i khro bos so //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mchog gi rdo rje'i khro bos so //
translated: For the purpose of conquering all the three worlds, [use] the supreme mudrā of Vajra-Wrath Trilokavijaya.

original: khams gsum thams cad dbab pa dang / dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / nges par gnon pa la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i khro bo'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad dbab pa dang / dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / nges par gnon pa la ni rdo rje sems dpa'i khro bo'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the purpose of causing all the three realms to descend, summon, enter, be enthralled, and be suppressed, [use] the mudra of Vajrasattva-Wrath.

original: khams gsum po thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing pa dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gnon par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa la ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje khro bo rdo rje'i dam tshig gi khro bos so //🔽bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: khams gsum po thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing pa dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / gnon par bya ba dang / bsgrub pa la ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje khro bo rdo rje'i dam tshig gi khro bos so // bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: For the purpose of completely captivating, summoning, introducing, binding, sealing, controlling, suppressing, and accomplishing all the three realms, it is the great wrathful one of great bliss, the great king of tantras of the wrathful one Vajra Samaya.

original: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called Vajra of the Conqueror of the Three Worlds, from the great king of tantras of the great bliss of Amoghasiddhi Vajra.

original: 'jig rten gsum rgyal gyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rgyal gyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: The conception of the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dag pa'i chos nyid thob pas yang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di gsungs
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid dag pa'i chos nyid thob pas yang chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di gsungs
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, having attained the pure nature of reality, again taught this method of the perfection of wisdom called the Wisdom-Mudra of Avalokitesvara, the Equality of All Dharmas.

original: te / 'dod chags thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten na zhe sdang thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te / 'dod chags thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten na zhe sdang thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: All hatreds are purified in the world through the purification of all desires.

original: dri ma thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyis @115b 'jig rten na sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma thams cad rnam par dag pa nyid kyis @115b 'jig rten na sdig pa thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: All non-virtues are purified in the world through the purification of all stains.

original: chos thams cad rnam par dag pas 'jig rten nas sems can thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par dag pas 'jig rten nas sems can thams cad rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: All sentient beings are purified in the world through the purification of all dharmas.

original: shes pa thams cad rnam par dag pas 'jig rten na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad rnam par dag pas 'jig rten na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is purified in the world through the purification of all consciousnesses.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapani,

original: gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de 'dod chags dang / dri ma thams cad kyi nang na 'dug kyang padmo lta bur 'dod chags kyi nyes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / klog pa dang / sgom pa de 'dod chags dang / dri ma thams cad kyi nang na 'dug kyang padmo lta bur 'dod chags kyi nyes pa rnams dang /
translated: Whoever listens to this method of the perfection of wisdom,🔽holds it, reads it, and meditates on it, even if they are sitting in the middle of desire and all defilements, they will not be tainted by the faults of desire,

original: dri ma rnams dang / glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri ma rnams dang / glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: defilements, or adventitious afflictions, like a lotus.

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug don gyi gnas 'di nyid yang rgya cher ston cing bzhin rab tu 'dzum dmul te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug don gyi gnas 'di nyid yang rgya cher ston cing bzhin rab tu 'dzum dmul te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, in order to teach this topic extensively, with a smiling face,

original: padma'i 'dab ma kha 'byed pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas mi gos pa la blta zhing 'gro ba thams cad kyi phyir padma'i gzugs sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs so //🔽hr'i:/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis padma chen po las de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan tham @116a *//
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma kha 'byed pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas mi gos pa la blta zhing 'gro ba thams cad kyi phyir padma'i gzugs sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs so // hr'i:/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis padma chen po las de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan tham @116a *//
translated: Looking at the opening of the lotus petals, unstained by the defilements of passion and so forth, for the sake of all beings, he spoke this essence called The Various Forms of the Lotus:🔽 Hrīḥ.

original: cad bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba'i padmas mtshan pa'i gzugs can nges par phyung nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rim pa dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bzhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: cad bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba'i padmas mtshan pa'i gzugs can nges par phyung nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rim pa dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bzhugs par gyur to //
translated: Then, as soon as this was spoken, from the great lotus all the reflected forms of the tathāgatas and so forth, with the forms of the blessed ones marked with lotuses, definitely emerged and remained in the manner of the first maṇḍala of the blessed Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug chos thams cad la gzigs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang phyug gi ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug chos thams cad la gzigs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang phyug gi ye shes kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po
translated: Then the bhagavān Avalokiteśvara entered into equipoise on the samādhi called the gnosis mudra of the lord of the gnosis that sees all phenomena, and the maṇḍala of all migrating beings was emanated.🔽

original: 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called the gnosis-seal of Avalokiteśvara, the lord of the eyes, the lord of the gnosis that sees all phenomena, and taught this great maṇḍala called Subjugating All Beings.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ci lta ba'i nang du gnyis pa ni zur bzhi pa la de bzhin du sgo dang / mtshams su bcas par bri'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ci lta ba'i nang du gnyis pa ni zur bzhi pa la de bzhin du sgo dang / mtshams su bcas par bri'o //
translated: Within the outer maṇḍala, the second maṇḍala should be drawn with four corners, just like the outer maṇḍala, with gates and intermediate points.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul du thig bzhis thig btab pa la tshon dmar pos padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul du thig bzhis thig btab pa la tshon dmar pos padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in the manner of the eight maṇḍalas, four lines should be drawn with red chalk, and an eight-petaled lotus should be drawn.

original: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das dgong par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das dgong par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, the Blessed One should be drawn.

original: de'i mdun du bcom ldan 'das padma chen po chags pa sku mdog dmar po padma'i gzugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de'i mdun du bcom ldan 'das padma chen po chags pa sku mdog dmar po padma'i gzugs 'dzin pa /
translated: In front of him, the Blessed One Mahāraktapadma should be drawn, red in color, holding the form of a lotus,

original: padma chen po dang / mda' dang / gzhu bsnams pa /
analyzed: padma chen po dang / mda' dang / gzhu bsnams pa /
translated: holding a great lotus, an arrow, and a bow.

original: g-yas su bcom ldan 'das padma chen po'i gtum po dbang phyug dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas su bcom ldan 'das padma chen po'i gtum po dbang phyug dbang phyug chen po'i gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the right, one should place the Blessed Great Lotus Caṇḍa, holding the form of Maheśvara, the great lord.

original: rgyab tu padma chen po khyab 'jug gi gzugs 'dzin pa sku mdog @116b nag po gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu padma chen po khyab 'jug gi gzugs 'dzin pa sku mdog @116b nag po gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the rear, one should place the black Great Lotus Viṣṇu, holding the form of Viṣṇu.

original: g-yon du padma chen po mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa sku mdog dkar po bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon du padma chen po mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa sku mdog dkar po bzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the left, one should place the white Great Lotus Brahmā, holding the form of Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world.

original: g-yas kyi mtshams su padma chen po sa 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi mtshams su padma chen po sa 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the right corner, one should place the Great Lotus Earth.

original: mtshams gnyis par padma chen po rgya mtsho chu lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams gnyis par padma chen po rgya mtsho chu lha'i gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the second corner, one should place the Great Lotus Ocean, holding the form of Varuṇa.

original: gsum par padma chen po nyi ma'i gzugs can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum par padma chen po nyi ma'i gzugs can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the third, one should place the Great Lotus Sun.

original: bzhi par padma chen po rlung gi gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi par padma chen po rlung gi gzugs 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the fourth, one should place the Great Lotus Wind, holding the form of Vāyu.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su shr'i h'i g'i dh'i lha mo bzhi gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su shr'i h'i g'i dh'i lha mo bzhi gzhag par bya ste /
translated: In the outer maṇḍala's corners, one should place the four goddesses Śrī, Hārī, Gaurī, and Dīpī.

original: thams cad kyang g-yas na rang gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang g-yas na rang gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa /
translated: All of them should hold their own emblems in their right hands,

original: g-yon pa padma 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa padma 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: and hold lotuses in their left hands.

original: sgo rnams su ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo rnams su ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya ste /
translated: At the gates one should place the emblems of passion, hatred, delusion, and nirvana,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: bud med kyi gzugs dang / sbrul gyi gzugs dang / phag gi gzugs dang / padma'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi gzugs dang / sbrul gyi gzugs dang / phag gi gzugs dang / padma'i gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: the forms of a woman, a snake, a pig, and a lotus.

original: de nas gos dkar po bgos te /
analyzed: de nas gos dkar po bgos te /
translated: Then, having put on white clothes,

original: gos dkar pos gdong g-yogs la padma chen po'i phyag rgya chen po me tog dang bcas par bcings te zhugs la me tog dor bar bya ste /
analyzed: gos dkar pos gdong g-yogs la padma chen po'i phyag rgya chen po me tog dang bcas par bcings te zhugs la me tog dor bar bya ste /
translated: having covered one’s face with a white cloth, having bound on the great lotus with the great seal together with a flower, having entered, and having cast the flower,

original: gang du babs pa de des bsgrub par bya'o //🔽de nas padma blangs la pad ma'i ming gis dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la 'di skad ces brjod par bya zhing padma'i 'dab @117a *//
analyzed: gang du babs pa de des bsgrub par bya'o // de nas padma blangs la pad ma'i ming gis dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la 'di skad ces brjod par bya zhing padma'i 'dab @117a *//
translated: one should practice that on which it falls.

original: ma la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma la blta bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having taken the lotus, having consecrated oneself with the consecration of the name of the lotus, one should say this and look at the lotus leaf:

original: ci ltar padma dmar po 'di //
analyzed: ci ltar padma dmar po 'di //
translated: “Just as this red lotus

original: tshon gyis nyes pas mi gos te //
analyzed: tshon gyis nyes pas mi gos te //
translated: He is not stained by the faults of the colors,

original: 'dam gyi nang na dag pa ltar //
analyzed: 'dam gyi nang na dag pa ltar //
translated: Just as a lotus is not stained by the mud.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang sogs de bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang sogs de bzhin //
translated: So it is with desire, anger, and so forth.

original: de ltar chos rnams bsgoms na ni //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams bsgoms na ni //
translated: If one meditates on phenomena in this way,

original: blo ldan nyon mongs bcas gyur kyang //
analyzed: blo ldan nyon mongs bcas gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the wise one is accompanied by afflictions,

original: nyon mongs kun las rnam grol nas //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun las rnam grol nas //
translated: He will be completely liberated from all afflictions

original: myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob 'gyur //
analyzed: myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob 'gyur //
translated: And quickly attain buddhahood.

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gzigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams kyi dbang phyug nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gzigs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams kyi dbang phyug nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By seeing this samādhi, one attains the state of being the lord of all tathāgatas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces mtshan btags so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces mtshan btags so //
translated: Then the Blessed One gave him the name Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas brtsams te bdag nyid kyi dngos po thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / bkra shis shing dngos grub thams cad byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du rjes su myong bar 'gyur zhing myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas brtsams te bdag nyid kyi dngos po thams cad shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / bkra shis shing dngos grub thams cad byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du rjes su myong bar 'gyur zhing myur du sangs rgyas nyid 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: From then on, all his own things became completely pure, auspicious, and all accomplishments were experienced up to the seat of awakening, and he quickly attained buddhahood.

original: slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The extensive rite for inducting the disciples is the same.

original: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of wisdom.

original: bsgrub pa la ni de bzhin du ras kyi ri mo gnyis kyis dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa la ni de bzhin du ras kyi ri mo gnyis kyis dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “For the sādhana, one will obtain all powers by means of the two cloth-paintings.

original: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni padma la lan stong bzlas te sbyin par bya'o //🔽thams cad gsad pa la ni padma chen po'i khro bo'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: de nas ma bsgrubs kyang thams cad rjes su chags par bya ba la ni padma la lan stong bzlas te sbyin par bya'o // thams cad gsad pa la ni padma chen po'i khro bo'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: “Then, for the rite of enthralling all without sādhana, one should offer a lotus flower enchanted one thousand times.🔽For the rite of killing all, one should use the mudrā of the wrathful great lotus.

original: thams @117b cad rmongs par bya ba la ni padma chen po phag gis so //
analyzed: thams @117b cad rmongs par bya ba la ni padma chen po phag gis so //
translated: For the rite of stupefying all, one should use the great lotus pig.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la ni padma chen po rnam par gzigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba la ni padma chen po rnam par gzigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the rite of purifying all afflictions, one should use the mudrā of the samādhi of the great lotus gaze.

original: sa thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du bya ba la ni sa la skyil mo krung bcas pas bzlas brjod 'bum byas nas mthar mtshan mo thog thag bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi bdag po nyid du bya ba la ni sa la skyil mo krung bcas pas bzlas brjod 'bum byas nas mthar mtshan mo thog thag bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For the rite of becoming the lord of all lands, one should sit cross-legged on the ground, perform one hundred thousand recitations, and at the end recite throughout the night.

original: chu thams cad dbab pa la ni klu bris nas de'i steng du 'dug nas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: chu thams cad dbab pa la ni klu bris nas de'i steng du 'dug nas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: For bringing down all water, draw a nāga and sit on top of it, and do a hundred thousand recitations.

original: thams cad snang bar bya ba la ni mun par nyi ma chen po'i 'od kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad snang bar bya ba la ni mun par nyi ma chen po'i 'od kyis so //
translated: For illuminating all, do it in the dark with the light of a great sun.

original: rlung thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba la ni padma chen po rlung gi mchog gis so //🔽bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: rlung thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba la ni padma chen po rlung gi mchog gis so // bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: For summoning, entering, binding, and controlling all winds, do it with a great lotus and the best of winds.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //🔽'gro ba 'dul ba'i rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so // 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rtog pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa khams gsum thams cad kyi dbang pos /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa khams gsum thams cad kyi dbang pos /
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.🔽This concludes the great king of tantras called The Tantra of the Great Lotus Vajrasattva, the Sacred Tantra of the Great King of Teachings.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba las byung ba ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad de /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba las byung ba ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad de /
translated: Again, this method of the perfection of wisdom called “The Essence of Wisdom Arising from the Consecration of All the Tathāgatas” was taught.

original: dbang bskur ba sbyin pa ni khams gsum thams cad kyi rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba sbyin pa ni khams gsum thams cad kyi rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The giving of consecration results in obtaining the kingship of the entire three realms.

original: nor @118a *// sbyin pa ni re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor @118a *// sbyin pa ni re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The giving of wealth results in the fulfillment of all hopes.

original: chos sbyin pa ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos sbyin pa ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The giving of the Dharma results in the attainment of the sameness of all dharmas.

original: zang zing sbyin pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi bde ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zang zing sbyin pa ni lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi bde ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The giving of material things results in the attainment of all the happiness of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po bzhin rab tu 'dzum pa dang bcas te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i snying po bzhin rab tu 'dzum pa dang bcas te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ākāśagarbha, with a very smiling face,

original: rang gi mgo la rdo rje rin po ches dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba 'ching zhing don yod pa 'di nyid rgya cher ston te /
analyzed: rang gi mgo la rdo rje rin po ches dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba 'ching zhing don yod pa 'di nyid rgya cher ston te /
translated: bound the garland of consecration with the vajra jewel on his own head and extensively taught this Amogha.

original: dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi dam tshig rin po che zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi dam tshig rin po che zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
translated: The essence of the pledge of all consecrations, called the jewel, was spoken.

original: tr'am/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi rin po che de la thams cad dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yo byad dang gter thams cad byung ste /
analyzed: tr'am/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi rin po che de la thams cad dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yo byad dang gter thams cad byung ste /
translated: Then, as soon as this was spoken, all the articles for consecration, and so forth, and all the treasures emerged from that jewel of the Transcendent Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyis bzhugs so //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi rin po che rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nor bu rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyis bzhugs so // de nas bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i snying po dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi rin po che rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nor bu rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i
translated: The Transcendent Lord remained in the form of a bodhisattva, in the manner of the original maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the Transcendent Lord Ākāśagarbha entered the meditative absorption called “the vajra jewel of all consecrations,” and taught this maṇḍala called “the pledge of the jewel that fulfills all wishes.”

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni dang po'i @118b dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du byas pa'i nang du rin po che zur brgyad pa /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni dang po'i @118b dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du byas pa'i nang du rin po che zur brgyad pa /
translated: In the center is an eight-faceted jewel,

original: rin po che'i ka ba brgyad la gnas pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i ka ba brgyad la gnas pa /
translated: resting on eight jewel pillars,

original: dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul las rin po che'i lcugs mas yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul las rin po che'i lcugs mas yongs su bskor ba /
translated: in the manner of an eight-petaled lotus, completely surrounded by jewel vines,

original: rdo rje rin po che'i ra ba dang / lcog dang / me tog gi phreng /
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che'i ra ba dang / lcog dang / me tog gi phreng /
translated: with a vajra-jewel fence, turrets, flower garlands,

original: ba dan dang / gdugs dang / rnga yab kyis nye bar mdzes pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba dan dang / gdugs dang / rnga yab kyis nye bar mdzes pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: banners, parasols, and yak-tail fans.

original: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das rta'i khri la bzhugs pa dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba rang nyid 'ching bar mdzad cing zhal rnam par bzhad pa mrgad kyi mdog can gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das rta'i khri la bzhugs pa dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba rang nyid 'ching bar mdzad cing zhal rnam par bzhad pa mrgad kyi mdog can gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that one should place the Blessed One, seated on a horse, wearing a consecration garland, with a smiling face, the color of emerald.

original: de'i mdun du byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba'i rin po che zhes bya ba rdo rje rin po che'i cod pan 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur ba'i rin po che zhes bya ba rdo rje rin po che'i cod pan 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In front of him one should place the bodhisattva called All-Tathāgata-Consecration-Jewel, holding a vajra-jewel crown.

original: g-yas su rin po che chen po'i nor sbyin pa dbyig gi gter 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas su rin po che chen po'i nor sbyin pa dbyig gi gter 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the right, one should place the great jewel giving wealth, holding a treasure of gold.

original: rgyab tu chos chen po rin po che'i glegs bam 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu chos chen po rin po che'i glegs bam 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: To the rear, one should place the great jewel of Dharma, holding a book.

original: g-yon du rin po che chen po ro myong ba zas dang skom thams cad 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //🔽mtshams rnams su mchod pa'i lha mo rnams rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rnga dang / srog shing rnams /
analyzed: g-yon du rin po che chen po ro myong ba zas dang skom thams cad 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o // mtshams rnams su mchod pa'i lha mo rnams rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / rnga dang / srog shing rnams /
translated: To the left, one should place the great jewel of taste, holding all food and drink.

original: 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions, one should place the offering goddesses holding jewel parasols, banners, and flags.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshams su bum pa gang ba rnams so //🔽sgo rnams su ni dbang @119a *//
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshams su bum pa gang ba rnams so // sgo rnams su ni dbang @119a *//
translated: In the outer directions, one should place the full vases.

original: bskur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bskur ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: At the doors, one should place the symbols of the consecration, and so forth.

original: phyi rol du ni gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bla re rnams kyis kun tu khyab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / bla re rnams kyis kun tu khyab par bya'o //
translated: Outside, one should fill it with parasols, banners, flags, and canopies.

original: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje rin chen gyi phyag rgya 'dzin pas zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje rin chen gyi phyag rgya 'dzin pas zhugs nas /
translated: Then, holding the great jewel vajra-seal, one should enter.

original: de nas brtsams te nor thams cad 'grub pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te nor thams cad 'grub pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, beginning from that time, one will obtain all powers, such as the accomplishment of all wealth, and so forth.

original: de nas zhugs nas kyang dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba bcings te rin po che blangs nas rin po che'i ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la sbyin pa thams cad phul nas slar dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhugs nas kyang dbang bskur ba'i phreng ba bcings te rin po che blangs nas rin po che'i ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la sbyin pa thams cad phul nas slar dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having entered, having tied the initiation-thread, having taken up the jewel, having been initiated by the initiation of the jewel name, having offered all gifts, one should be dismissed.

original: slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The extensive rite of entering the disciple is also like that.

original: rdo rje rin po che'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of the vajra jewel.

original: sgrub pa dang dngos grub rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dngos grub rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The accomplishments and powers are also like that.

original: de nas ma bsgrubs par dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa la ni rdo rje rin po che'i dbang bskur ba'i phreng bas so //
analyzed: de nas ma bsgrubs par dbang bskur ba thams cad thob pa la ni rdo rje rin po che'i dbang bskur ba'i phreng bas so //
translated: Then, for the attainment of all initiations without accomplishment, [there is] the initiation-thread of the vajra jewel initiation.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa la ni nyin re zhing nyi ma 'char kar bzlas brjod dpag tu med pa byas pas so //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa la ni nyin re zhing nyi ma 'char kar bzlas brjod dpag tu med pa byas pas so //
translated: For the fulfillment of all wishes, [there is] the recitation of the mantra countless times at sunrise each day.

original: chos thams cad kyi don shes pa la ni dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' la blta zhing bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi don shes pa la ni dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' la blta zhing bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For understanding the meaning of all dharmas, one should look at the stainless sky and recite.

original: zas dang / skom thams cad la sogs pa dang / ro thams cad thob par bya @119b ba la ni nam mkha' las yid la 'dod pa bzhin du nyin re zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi bzlas brjod stong byas pas so //
analyzed: zas dang / skom thams cad la sogs pa dang / ro thams cad thob par bya @119b ba la ni nam mkha' las yid la 'dod pa bzhin du nyin re zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi bzlas brjod stong byas pas so //
translated: For obtaining all foods and drinks and all tastes, one should recite the mantra of the Blessed One one thousand times each day, as desired, from the sky.

original: shin tu mthon po thob phar bya ba la ni gdugs bzung nas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthon po thob phar bya ba la ni gdugs bzung nas bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: For attaining the very highest, one should hold up an umbrella and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: rnam par rgyal ba chen po thob pa la ni rin chen rgyal mtshan mchog gis so //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba chen po thob pa la ni rin chen rgyal mtshan mchog gis so //
translated: For attaining great victory, one should use the supreme jewel victory banner.

original: grags pa dang / snyan pa chen po dang / ming thob par bya ba la ni nyin re zhing kha thams cad du bltas nas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: grags pa dang / snyan pa chen po dang / ming thob par bya ba la ni nyin re zhing kha thams cad du bltas nas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For attaining great fame, renown, and a name, one should recite the mantra while looking in all directions each day.

original: bdag po chen po thob pa la ni rin po che'i srog shing gi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: bdag po chen po thob pa la ni rin po che'i srog shing gi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For attaining great lordship, one should use the jewel life-tree mudrā.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: The great king of tantras, the great vajra pledge of Amoghasiddhi of great bliss.

original: dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thams cad kyi rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: The great king of tantras called the jewel pledge of all empowerments is complete.

original: rin po che'i rigs kyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs kyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: The tantra of the jewel family.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes phyag rgya thob pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes phyag rgya thob pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata who has attained the wisdom seal of all tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur 'dzin pa /
translated: the holder of the fist of all tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i byin gyis rlob pa rdo rje zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i byin gyis rlob pa rdo rje zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
translated: the eternal tathāgata, again explained this method of the perfection of wisdom called the vajra empowerment of the wisdom seal of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du @120a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du @120a *//
translated: The holder of the seal of the body of all tathāgatas is all tathāgatas themselves.

original: 'gyur ro // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By holding the seal of the speech of all the Tathāgatas, one will attain all dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la ni rdo rje bsnyems pa'i khu tshur gyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid la ni rdo rje bsnyems pa'i khu tshur gyis so //
translated: For the state of Vajra Holder, the vajra pride fist.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i khu tshur gyis so //🔽bde ba chen po'i rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i khu tshur gyis so // bde ba chen po'i rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: In the case of buddhahood itself, it is by the vajra fist of all the tathāgatas.🔽In the Great King of Yogin’s Tantras, the Glorious Esoteric Community of the Vajra of Body, Speech, and Mind of all the Tathāgatas, this is the chapter on the vajra fist of all the seals, the twenty-first.

original: @123a *// phyag rgya thams cad kyi khu tshur gyi dam tshig ces bya ba rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: @123a *// phyag rgya thams cad kyi khu tshur gyi dam tshig ces bya ba rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: The great king of yogin’s tantras, the Glorious Esoteric Community of All the Tathāgatas, is complete.

original: khu tshur gyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: khu tshur gyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: The chapter on the vajra fist.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas yang 'khor lo ltar yi ge bskor ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //🔽ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad stong pa'o //🔽mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas yang 'khor lo ltar yi ge bskor ba zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do // ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad stong pa'o // mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata of all phenomena without conceptual elaboration, explained this method of the perfection of wisdom called the wheel-like arrangement of the letters.🔽All phenomena are empty by the method of having no nature.🔽All phenomena are signless by the method of having no signs.

original: smon pa med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad smon pa med pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are wishless by the method of having no wishes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is pure, all phenomena are naturally luminous.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas don 'di rgya cher ston te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas don 'di rgya cher ston te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the youthful Mañjuśrī, taught this meaning extensively.

original: bzhin 'dzum bzhin du ral gri des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'debs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i mchog 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum bzhin du ral gri des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'debs shing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po'i mchog 'di gsungs so //
translated: With a smiling face, he struck all the tathāgatas with that sword and spoke this essence of the perfection of wisdom:🔽Aḥ.

original: aa / de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa mdzad nas dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: aa / de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus pa mdzad nas dang po'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis bzhugs so //
translated: Then, as soon as this was spoken, all the tathāgatas gathered and remained in the form of the original maṇḍala.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pas spros pa med pa'i ral gri zhes bya @123b ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'khor lo ltar yi ge bskor ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pas spros pa med pa'i ral gri zhes bya @123b ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'khor lo ltar yi ge bskor ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the youthful Mañjuśrī, through all phenomena being without inherent nature, entered the samādhi called The Sword of the Absence of Mental Fabrication and spoke this maṇḍala called The Wheel-like Arrangement of Syllables:

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ci lta ba'i nang du 'khor lo bris la /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ci lta ba'i nang du 'khor lo bris la /
translated: Having drawn a wheel in the inner [circle] in accordance with the outer maṇḍala,

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phreng ba go rims bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phreng ba go rims bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the garland of syllables beginning with a in order.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul gyis thig btab la de'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nu gzhon nu'i cha lugs 'chang zhing 'dzum pa dang bcas pa nam mkha'i mdog can phyag bzhi dang / ral gris de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'debs par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i tshul gyis thig btab la de'i lte ba la bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nu gzhon nu'i cha lugs 'chang zhing 'dzum pa dang bcas pa nam mkha'i mdog can phyag bzhi dang / ral gris de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'debs par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, having laid out the lines in the manner of the eight maṇḍalas, one should place the youthful Mañjuśrī, the Blessed One, in the center, with the form of a youth, smiling, the color of the sky, with four arms, and with a sword, as if striking all the tathāgatas.

original: de'i mdun la sogs par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun la sogs par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The forms of the tathāgatas should be placed in front of him, and so forth.

original: phyi'i mtshams rnams su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi lung ji ltar thob pa bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i mtshams rnams su shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi lung ji ltar thob pa bzhin du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the outer directions, the four perfections of wisdom should be placed as they are obtained in the scriptures.

original: sgo rnams su ni mtshan ma bzhi gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo rnams su ni mtshan ma bzhi gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the gates, the four signs should be placed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ral gri dang / mdung dang / lhung bzed dang / glegs bam rnams so //
analyzed: ral gri dang / mdung dang / lhung bzed dang / glegs bam rnams so //
translated: the sword, the spear, the alms bowl, and the scripture.

original: de nas ral gri dang / glegs bam gyi phyag rgya de bzhin du chos kyi slob dpon du byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: de nas ral gri dang / glegs bam gyi phyag rgya de bzhin du chos kyi slob dpon du byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: Then, with the mudrā of the sword and the scripture, one should consecrate oneself as the master of the Dharma.

original: de nas ral gri blangs te ral gri'i ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la 'di skad ces chos 'di bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas ral gri blangs te ral gri'i ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur la 'di skad ces chos 'di bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, taking up the sword, one should confer empowerment with the empowerment of the name of the sword, and one should explain this Dharma:

original: ral gri 'di ni rtag zungs la //
analyzed: ral gri 'di ni rtag zungs la //
translated: “Always hold this sword

original: shes rab tshul 'di bkar smra zhing //🔽nam mkhar sangs rgyas @124a *//
analyzed: shes rab tshul 'di bkar smra zhing // nam mkhar sangs rgyas @124a *//
translated: and proclaim this method of wisdom.

original: sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sbyor ba yis //
translated: If one strikes with the application of the buddhas

original: 'debs na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'debs na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: in the sky, one will quickly be successful.🔽In order to protect the teachings of the Buddha

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa bsrung phyir dang // sems can mang po bsrung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa bsrung phyir dang // sems can mang po bsrung ba'i phyir //
translated: and in order to protect many sentient beings,

original: 'dis bsad sdig par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'dis bsad sdig par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: there is no sin in killing with this;

original: bsod nams dag kyang thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsod nams dag kyang thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will also attain merit.

original: slob ma rnams la'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la'ang de bzhin te //
translated: The same applies to the disciples.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i dngos grub rnams kyis myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and by the powers that come from perfecting the perfection of wisdom, they will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, full awakening.

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the Dharma maṇḍala.

original: sgrub pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The accomplishment is also like that.

original: ma bsgrubs par yang de bzhin du las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni thams cad nam mkha' bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: ma bsgrubs par yang de bzhin du las rnams 'grub par 'gyur ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni thams cad nam mkha' bsgoms pas so //
translated: Even without accomplishment, actions are accomplished in the same way. For one who has attained the emptiness meditative stabilization, all is meditated as space.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni mtshan ma dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni mtshan ma dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas so //
translated: For one who has attained the signless meditative stabilization, the meditative stabilization free from signs is meditated.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni smon pa med pa bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa la ni smon pa med pa bsgoms pas so //
translated: For one who has attained the wishless meditative stabilization, the wishless is meditated.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi ye shes thob pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi ye shes thob pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas so //
translated: For one who has attained the wisdom of the naturally radiant Dharma, the perfection of wisdom is meditated.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod pa la ni chos bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod pa la ni chos bsgoms pas so //
translated: For the cutting of all afflictions, it is through the cultivation of the Dharma.

original: yi ge thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig gi ye shes la ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig gi ye shes la ni spros pa med pa'i ye shes bsgoms pas so //
translated: For the knowledge of the etymologies of all letters, it is through the cultivation of non-elaborate knowledge.

original: gnas thams @124b cad du yi ges chos kyi bya ba mthong bas ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i ngo bo nyid bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: gnas thams @124b cad du yi ges chos kyi bya ba mthong bas ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'i ngo bo nyid bsgoms pas so //
translated: For the seeing of the activity of the Dharma with letters in all places, it is through the cultivation of the essence of the letters A and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub pa thob pa la ni rdo rje'i ral gri'i phyag rgyas so //🔽bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub pa thob pa la ni rdo rje'i ral gri'i phyag rgyas so // bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: For the attainment of the enlightenment of all the Tathāgatas, it is with the vajra sword mudrā.

original: 'khor lo chen po ltar yi ge bskor ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po ltar yi ge bskor ba'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called “The Commitment of the Wheel of Letters Like a Great Wheel,” from the Great King of Tantras of the Awareness of Great Bliss, the Commitment of Vajradhara, the Jewel of the Vajra Body, Speech, and Mind of all Tathāgatas.

original: 'jam dpal gyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: The Tantra of Mañjuśrī

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i nang du 'dus ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas yang 'khor lo chen po la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i nang du 'dus ba'i de bzhin gshegs pas yang 'khor lo chen po la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata who has gathered into the wheel of all Tathāgatas, again explained this method of the perfection of wisdom called “Entering the Great Wheel.”

original: rdo rje mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Entering the sameness of vajra is entering the wheel of all Tathāgatas.

original: don gyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Entering the sameness of meaning is entering the wheel of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Entering the sameness of all phenomena is entering the wheel of the sublime Dharma.

original: thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni 'khor lo thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa ni 'khor lo thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Entering the sameness of everything is entering all wheels.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba chos nyid kyi don 'di rgya cher @125a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba chos nyid kyi don 'di rgya cher @125a *//
translated: Then, the bodhisattva who had just generated the mind of awakening, having extensively taught the meaning of the reality of the wheel of dharma,

original: ston cing bzhin rab tu 'dzum nas rdo rje'i 'khor lo bskor zhing rdo rje 'khor lo thams cad la 'jug pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
analyzed: ston cing bzhin rab tu 'dzum nas rdo rje'i 'khor lo bskor zhing rdo rje 'khor lo thams cad la 'jug pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
translated: with a smiling face, turned the vajra wheel and spoke this essence called “the pledge of entering all vajra wheels”:🔽Huṃ.

original: h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po can khams gsum tu gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sems dpa' rnams
analyzed: h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po can khams gsum tu gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sems dpa' rnams
translated: As soon as this was said, all the beings belonging to the three realms, who are the essence of all tathāgatas, entered all the maṇḍalas and, from the heart of the blessed one, the pledge beings of all maṇḍalas

original: nges par byung nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis ci lta ba bzhin du bzhugs so //
analyzed: nges par byung nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis ci lta ba bzhin du bzhugs so //
translated: emerged and took their places in the maṇḍala arrangement.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje khro bo'i 'khor lo thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dkyil 'khor chen po thams cad du 'jug pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i 'khor lo'i
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje khro bo'i 'khor lo thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dkyil 'khor chen po thams cad du 'jug pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i 'khor lo'i
translated: Then the bhagavān entered into equipoise on the samādhi called the mudra of entering all the maṇḍalas of the vajra wrathful ones and the maṇḍala of the mudra of entering all maṇḍalas.🔽

original: dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called “the seal of entry into the entire wheel of the wrathful vajra bodhisattvas,” and taught this wheel maṇḍala called “the pledge of entry into the entire great maṇḍala”:

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du byas te /🔽nang gi dkyil 'khor du rdo rje 'khor lo bris la /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du byas te / nang gi dkyil 'khor du rdo rje 'khor lo bris la /
translated: “One should draw the outer maṇḍala as before.🔽In the inner maṇḍala, one should draw a vajra wheel.

original: dbus su rdo rje'i 'khor lo bskor ba gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje'i 'khor lo bskor ba gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center, one should place a vajra wheel-turning [image].

original: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dkyil 'khor dang po'i tshul du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dkyil 'khor dang po'i tshul du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: All the bodhisattvas such as Vajrapāṇi should be placed in every way according to the first maṇḍala method.

original: phyi'i mtshams rnams su rdo rje'i @125b rigs kyi dkyil 'khor bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i mtshams rnams su rdo rje'i @125b rigs kyi dkyil 'khor bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the outer directions, one should draw the four maṇḍalas of the vajra family.

original: sgo rnams su mtshan ma bzhi gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo rnams su mtshan ma bzhi gzhag par bya ste /
translated: At the gates, one should place the four emblems.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku dang / rdo rje khro bo'i sku dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i sku rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku dang / rdo rje khro bo'i sku dang / spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i sku rnams so //
translated: the body of Vajrasattva, the body of Vajrakrodha, the body of Avalokitesvara, and the body of Akasagarbha.

original: de nas rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor thams cad du sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor thams cad du sangs rgyas nyid dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, with the gesture of the vajra wheel, one should attain the state of Buddhahood and the state of Vajradhara in all the mandalas, just as it is.

original: de nas 'khor lo blangs la 'khor lo'i ming gi dbang bskur ba blang bar bya zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'i thig btab pa'i rigs rnams su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo blangs la 'khor lo'i ming gi dbang bskur ba blang bar bya zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhi'i thig btab pa'i rigs rnams su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken up the wheel, one should take up the empowerment of the name of the wheel and enter into the families of the four secret mandalas.

original: slob ma gzhug pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The initiation of the disciple is also like that.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of the vajra wheel.

original: sgrub pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The practice is also like that.

original: ma bsgrubs par yang dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa la ni rdo rje 'khor los te /
analyzed: ma bsgrubs par yang dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa la ni rdo rje 'khor los te /
translated: For entering into all the mandalas without practice, it is with the vajra wheel.

original: rang gi khar bcug la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi khar bcug la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having placed it in one's mouth, one should enter.

original: dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug pa la ni rdo rje 'khor lo chen pos so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug pa la ni rdo rje 'khor lo chen pos so //
translated: For entering the great maṇḍala, it is with the great vajra wheel.

analyzed: de bzhin du dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la ni dam tshig chen po'i 'khor los so //

original: las kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la ni rdo rje thams cad kyi 'khor los so //
analyzed: las kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la ni rdo rje thams cad kyi 'khor los so //
translated: For entering the action maṇḍala, it is with the wheel of all vajras.

original: de bzhin du @126a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du @126a *//
translated: Similarly,

original: rjes su chags par bya ba dang / dbang du bya ba dang / don thob pa dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / gcad pa dang / 'jug pa dang / mchod pa dang / gdug pa 'dul ba'i las rnams la ni sems dpa' chen po brgyad kyi phyag rgya g-yon na 'khor lo dang bcas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rjes su chags par bya ba dang / dbang du bya ba dang / don thob pa dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / gcad pa dang / 'jug pa dang / mchod pa dang / gdug pa 'dul ba'i las rnams la ni sems dpa' chen po brgyad kyi phyag rgya g-yon na 'khor lo dang bcas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: for the activities of arousing passion, controlling, obtaining the goal, sealing, cutting, entering, worship, and subduing the wicked, it is with the seals of the eight great beings, all of which have wheels in the left [hands].

analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi rdo rje'i dam tshig ces bya ba rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //

original: rdo rje 'khor lo'i rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo'i rtog pa'o ////

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa thams cad kyi cho ga rgyas pa snod kyi mchod pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa thams cad kyi cho ga rgyas pa snod kyi mchod pa thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One explained this method of the perfection of wisdom, called the supreme offering of all vessels, the extensive ritual of offering to all tathāgatas:

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'o //
translated: The generation of the mind of enlightenment itself is the extensive ritual of offering to all tathāgatas.

analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su skyob pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'o //

analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yi ger 'dri ba dang / yi ger 'drir 'jug pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / @126b klog pa dang / brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang /
translated: The extensive rite of worship of all the Tathāgatas is to uphold the true Dharma.🔽The extensive rite of worship of all the Tathāgatas is to write out the perfection of wisdom, to cause it to be written out, to take it up, to recite it, to explain it, to teach it, to listen to it, to reflect on it, to meditate on it,

original: mchod pa byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa byed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'o //

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i mdzod don de nyid rgya cher ston te /

analyzed: bzhin rab tu 'dzum zhing las thams cad don yod pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
translated: with a smiling face, spoke this essence called the pledge of the unfailing purpose of all activities:🔽Oṃ.

original: aom/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' thams cad las mchod pa thams cad kyi cho ga rgyas pa /
analyzed: aom/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis nam mkha' thams cad las mchod pa thams cad kyi cho ga rgyas pa /

original: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par spros par gyur nas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par spros par gyur nas /
translated: Having pervaded the entire realm of space,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i mdzod kyi byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du bzhugs so //

translated: Then, the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha entered the samādhi called “the consecration of the extensive rite of all offerings” and taught this maṇḍala called the “vajra supreme offering, Amoghavajra pledge.”

original: // phyi'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du rin po che'i ka ba brgyad byas la /
analyzed: // phyi'i dkyil 'khor ji lta ba de bzhin du nang du rin po che'i ka ba brgyad byas la /

analyzed: dbus su bcom ldan 'das mtshon cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa /

original: zhal 'dzum pa /
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa /

analyzed: sku dang / yan lag zla ba'i mdog la sogs pa'i kha dog lnga pa'i mdog can gzhag par bya'o //

original: byang chub kyi sems dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya yongs su 'dzin pa dang / stong pa nyid du smra ba dang / dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang / mchod pa thams cad dang / sems can rnams yongs su skyob pa ni bla na med pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga rgyas pa phyag na 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis ci lta ba bzhin du gzhag go /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /

analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po rdzogs so //

analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod kyi rtog pa'o ////

translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata who is able to subdue all evildoers,
