original: phyag na rdo rje sogs mtshan 'chad //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje sogs mtshan 'chad //
translated: with the names of Vajrapāṇi and so on.

original: phyi yi dkyil 'khor mtshams rnams su //
analyzed: phyi yi dkyil 'khor mtshams rnams su //
translated: In the corners of the outer maṇḍala,

original: mche ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya //
analyzed: mche ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw the mudrā of the fangs.

original: sgo yi gnas ni thams cad du //
analyzed: sgo yi gnas ni thams cad du //
translated: The signs of the vajra should be placed

original: rdo rje'i mtshan ma gzhag par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mtshan ma gzhag par bya //
translated: in all the places of the doors.

original: de nas 'jug pa la sogs pa 'byung ste //
analyzed: de nas 'jug pa la sogs pa 'byung ste //
translated: Then, entry and so forth occur.

original: rdo rje mche ba'i phyag rgya dang // ha ha zhes bzhad pa dang bcas pas zhugs nas gdug pa thams cad 'dul nus shing myur du rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje mche ba'i phyag rgya dang // ha ha zhes bzhad pa dang bcas pas zhugs nas gdug pa thams cad 'dul nus shing myur du rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered with the vajra-fang mudra and a loud laugh of ha ha, one is able to subdue all evildoers and quickly attain the state of Vajra Holder.

original: de nas zhugs nas rdo rje mche ba blangs nas rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur la rdo rjes rdo rje gnod sbyin nyid la bsnun no //
analyzed: de nas zhugs nas rdo rje mche ba blangs nas rdo rje ming gis dbang bskur la rdo rjes rdo rje gnod sbyin nyid la bsnun no //
translated: Then, having entered, one should take up the vajra fang, confer the empowerment of the vajra name, and strike with the vajra at Vajra-Yaka himself.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi zhal nas ha ha zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad srung ba po gnod sbyin gyi @129a *//
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi zhal nas ha ha zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad srung ba po gnod sbyin gyi @129a *//
translated: Then, from the mouth of Vajra-Yaka, the sound of ha ha will emerge.

original: bdag po phyag na rdo rje gtum por bdag grub pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po phyag na rdo rje gtum por bdag grub pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should know that the Blessed One, the protector of all tathagatas, the lord of yakshas, the fierce Vajrapani, is accomplished.

original: de nas phyag rgya thams cad bcing bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya thams cad bcing bar bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then one should form all the seals and practice.

original: de nas mchod la de bzhin du yang dag par tshim par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas mchod la de bzhin du yang dag par tshim par byas nas /
translated: Then one should worship and likewise satisfy them.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di lan gcig brjod la slar dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di lan gcig brjod la slar dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should recite this method of the perfection of wisdom once and dismiss them.

original: de bzhin du phyag rgya bcing ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa ni dang po la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag rgya bcing ba la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa ni dang po la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the extensive ritual of forming the seals, etc., should be done in all the mandalas, beginning with the first.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the mandala of Vajrapāṇi.

original: sgrub pa dang / dngos grub kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / dngos grub kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The practice and the powers are the same as before,

original: ma bsgrubs par yang dang po ci lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bsgrubs par yang dang po ci lta ba bzhin no //
translated: but without the preliminary practice.

original: gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba la ni rdo rje ma che ba'i phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad 'dul ba la ni rdo rje ma che ba'i phyag rgyas so //
translated: For subduing all evildoers, use the great vajra seal.

original: sems can thams cad 'dul ba la ni khro bos ha ha zhes dgod cing zlos pas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'dul ba la ni khro bos ha ha zhes dgod cing zlos pas so //
translated: For subduing all sentient beings, use the wrathful one, laughing ha ha, and recite.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba las ltung bar bya ba la ni chos gos dang / snam sbyar gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba las ltung bar bya ba la ni chos gos dang / snam sbyar gyi sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: For the purpose of causing the downfall of those who are free from desire in the Śrāvakayāna and the Pratyekabuddhayāna, one should perform a fire sacrifice with the robes and patched robes.

original: dbang bskur ba thams cad da brog pa la ni khams thams cad kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thams cad da brog pa la ni khams thams cad kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis so //
translated: For the purpose of destroying all consecrations, one should perform a fire sacrifice with all the powders.

original: thams cad rgyas gdab pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgyas so //
analyzed: thams cad rgyas gdab pa la ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgyas so //
translated: For the purpose of sealing all, one should use the mudrā of the vajra fist.

original: thams cad bcad pa la ni gzugs brnyan byas nas gtub pas so //
analyzed: thams cad bcad pa la ni gzugs brnyan byas nas gtub pas so //
translated: For the purpose of cutting all, one should make an effigy and cut it up.

original: ma rungs pa thams cad kyi @129b dkyil 'khor rnam par gzhig pa la ni rdo rje bzung nas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pa thams cad kyi @129b dkyil 'khor rnam par gzhig pa la ni rdo rje bzung nas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of destroying the maṇḍala of all evildoers, one should enter while holding the vajra.

original: mchod pa thams cad rnam par gzhig pa la ni khros nas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad rnam par gzhig pa la ni khros nas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of destroying all worship, one should recite wrathfully.

original: thams cad skrag par bya ba la ni 'jigs byed kyi lta bas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad skrag par bya ba la ni 'jigs byed kyi lta bas blta bar bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of terrifying all, one should look with the gaze of Bhairava.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje don yod pa'i dam tshig gi rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the maṇḍala of the great king Vaiśravaṇa, the twenty-first chapter of the great tantra of the awareness of the great Vajra Akṣobhya.

original: rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: The great king of tantras called “The Vajra Commitment” is complete.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi rtog pa'o ////
translated: The Vajra Yakṣa Tantra

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas yang chos thams cad kyis mchog ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas yang chos thams cad kyis mchog ces bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Abiding in the Equality of All Phenomena, again explained this method of the perfection of wisdom called “The Supreme of All Phenomena”:

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: “All phenomena are equal, therefore the perfection of wisdom is equal.

original: thams cad don nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad don nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don nyid do //
translated: All are meaningful, therefore the perfection of wisdom is meaningful.

original: thams cad chos nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad chos nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos nyid do //
translated: All are the nature of phenomena, therefore the perfection of wisdom is the nature of phenomena.

original: thams cad las nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad las nyid pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: All are action, therefore the perfection of wisdom should be known as action.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don yod pa'i dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas don @130a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don yod pa'i dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas don @130a *//
translated: Then the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi entered into the samādhi called “the consecration of the maṇḍala of the pledge of Amogha, the tathāgatas and all bodhisattvas.”🔽

original: yod pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
analyzed: yod pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i snying po 'di smras so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vajrapāṇi, entered the meditative absorption called “the consecration of the maṇḍala of the pledge of Amogha,” of all the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas, and uttered this essence mantra called “the pledge of all Amoghas”:🔽Hūṃ.

original: h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa dkyil 'khor thams cad thugs las byung ste /
analyzed: h'um/ de nas 'di gsungs pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa dkyil 'khor thams cad thugs las byung ste /
translated: Then, as soon as he had uttered this, all the maṇḍalas of all the tathāgatas and so forth arose from his heart,

original: dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor chen po der zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: dam tshig gi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor chen po der zhugs par gyur to //
translated: and entered the maṇḍala of the great vajra of the reality of the pledge.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la nges par btud de dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la nges par btud de dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi bowed to the two feet of the Blessed One and taught this maṇḍala of the great pledge:

original: dkyil 'khor chen po bris la dkyil 'khor gyi gnas brgyad du rdo rje khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor so sor gzhag go /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po bris la dkyil 'khor gyi gnas brgyad du rdo rje khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor so sor gzhag go /
translated: Having drawn the great maṇḍala, one should place the maṇḍala of Vajra Tripiṭaka, and so on, in the eight maṇḍala places.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje dam tshig thams cad kyi rdo rje byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dam tshig thams cad kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje dam tshig thams cad kyi rdo rje byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dam tshig thams cad kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di gsungs so //
translated: Then the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi entered the samādhi called “Vajra Empowerment of All Vows,” and taught this maṇḍala called “Vajra of All Vows”:

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris la /
translated: “Having drawn the outer maṇḍala in the manner of the great maṇḍala,

original: de'i dbus su rdo rje 'khor lo bris nas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rdo rje 'khor lo bris nas /
translated: in the center of that one should draw a vajra wheel.

original: 'khor lo'i gnas rnams su dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gnas rnams su dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the places of the wheel one should draw the great maṇḍala and so on.

original: thams cad kyang dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i thig gis btab cing sems dpa' chen po gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang dkyil 'khor brgyad pa'i thig gis btab cing sems dpa' chen po gzhag par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be marked with the thread lines of the eight maṇḍalas, and the great beings should be placed.”

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor du phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i @130b rigs ci ltar rjes su mthun par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor du phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i @130b rigs ci ltar rjes su mthun par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the outer maṇḍala, one should draw whatever is appropriate from the outer vajra family.

original: sgo rnams su ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo rnams su ni rigs rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan ma rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: At the gates, one should place the symbols of the four types of families.

original: de nas dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga thams cad rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Then, by the method of the great maṇḍala of the vajra reality of the great commitment, one should perform all the maṇḍala rites extensively.

original: dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje'i de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje'i de kho na nyid kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po las /
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called “The Vajra Reality of the Great Commitment,” from “The Tantra of the Great King of Choices of All the Tathāgatas.”

original: bde ba thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi dam tshig ces bya ba'i rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the great king of tantras called “The Commitment of All Bliss.”

original: rigs bsdus pa'i rtog pa'o ////
analyzed: rigs bsdus pa'i rtog pa'o ////
translated: The Tantra of the Compilation of Families

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rnam par snang mdzad kyis yang sems can thams cad byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rnam par snang mdzad kyis yang sems can thams cad byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul 'di bshad do //
translated: Then the bhagavat tathagata Vairocana explained this method of the perfection of wisdom called “the blessing of all sentient beings”:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no //
translated: “The bodhisattva mahasattva Samantabhadra is the nature of all, and all sentient beings have the tathagata essence.

original: thams cad rdo rje'i snying pos dbang bskur ba nyid pas sems can thams cad ni rdo rje'i snying po can /
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje'i snying pos dbang bskur ba nyid pas sems can thams cad ni rdo rje'i snying po can /
translated: All have the vajra essence because they are empowered by the vajra essence.

original: ngag thams cad rab tu byung bas sems can thams cad ni chos kyi snying po can no //
analyzed: ngag thams cad rab tu byung bas sems can thams cad ni chos kyi snying po can no //
translated: All sentient beings have the dharma essence because all speech is fully ordained.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba byed pa la sbyor bas sems can thams cad ni las kyi snying po can no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bya ba byed pa la sbyor bas sems can thams cad ni las kyi snying po can no //
translated: All sentient beings have the karma essence because they are applied to performing the activities of all sentient beings.”

original: de nas phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs @131a *//
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs @131a *//
translated: Then the external vajra family

original: rnams kyis ca co'i sgra phyung nas chos nyid kyi don rgya cher ston cing snying po phul te /
analyzed: rnams kyis ca co'i sgra phyung nas chos nyid kyi don rgya cher ston cing snying po phul te /
translated: The entire assembly of gods then let out a cry of Ah! and revealed the meaning of reality in an extensive way, and offered the essence.

original: de nas rdo rje dbang phyug chen po rang gi de kho na nyid kyi snying po 'di phul lo //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dbang phyug chen po rang gi de kho na nyid kyi snying po 'di phul lo //
translated: Then the great Īśvara Vajra offered this essence of his very own reality:🔽Tra.

original: tri / de nas dkyil 'khor bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tri / de nas dkyil 'khor bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then the maṇḍala should be explained:

original: kun nas zlum po thig gsum pa dkyil 'khor chen po sgo bzhi pa mtshams rnams su mdung rtse gsum pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas zlum po thig gsum pa dkyil 'khor chen po sgo bzhi pa mtshams rnams su mdung rtse gsum pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: A great maṇḍala with three circles all around, with four gates, and with three-pointed spears drawn in the intermediate directions.

original: de'i dbus su dbang phyug chen po bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su dbang phyug chen po bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, the great Īśvara should be drawn.

original: de'i logs thams cad du tshogs brgyad pe bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i logs thams cad du tshogs brgyad pe bri bar bya ste /
translated: In all the corners, the eight assemblies should be drawn.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽nag po chen po dang / dga' byed dbang phyug dang / dril chen dang / gar gyi dbang phyug rnams ni phyogs rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nag po chen po dang / dga' byed dbang phyug dang / dril chen dang / gar gyi dbang phyug rnams ni phyogs rnams su'o //
translated: They are as follows:🔽 Mahākāla, Nandikeśvara, Ghaṇṭāpa, and Nāṭeśvara are in the directions.

original: mtshams su ni thod pa bzang po dang / gtum po'i dbang phyug dang / lag na kha tvam ga dang / ba lang rna ba'i dbang phyug go /
analyzed: mtshams su ni thod pa bzang po dang / gtum po'i dbang phyug dang / lag na kha tvam ga dang / ba lang rna ba'i dbang phyug go /
translated: In the intermediate directions, there are Bhadrapātra, Caṇḍeśvara, Khaṭvāṅga, and Gośīrṣeśvara.

original: thig gi mchams su ni ma mo'i tshogs thams cad gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: thig gi mchams su ni ma mo'i tshogs thams cad gnas ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the corners of the grid, one should draw all the hosts of mātṛs in their respective places.

original: sgo rnams su ni dbyug pa'i dbang phyug dang / mgo'i dbang phyug dang / dril rna dang / drag po chen po'o //
analyzed: sgo rnams su ni dbyug pa'i dbang phyug dang / mgo'i dbang phyug dang / dril rna dang / drag po chen po'o //
translated: At the gates, one should draw Daṇḍeśvara, Śirasāṃśvara, Ghaṇṭākarṇa, and Mahācaṇḍa.

original: phyi rol tu ni 'byung po rnams dang / yi ge rnams bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni 'byung po rnams dang / yi ge rnams bri bar bya'o //
translated: Outside, one should draw the bhūtas and the letters.

original: de nas slob dpon thal ba gtsang mas lus bskus shing gos gtsang ma bgos te /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon thal ba gtsang mas lus bskus shing gos gtsang ma bgos te /
translated: Then the master, having anointed his body with pure ash and put on clean clothes,

original: mdung rtse gsum gyi mtshan ma gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mdung rtse gsum gyi mtshan ma gzhag par bya'o //
translated: should place the trident emblem.

original: zhugs nas kyang snying po bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang snying po bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having entered, he should recite the essence mantra.

original: de nas slob @131b ma de bzhin du bcug la lag par mdung rtse gsum pa byin nas chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob @131b ma de bzhin du bcug la lag par mdung rtse gsum pa byin nas chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: Then, having caused the disciple to enter in the same way, having given him the trident in his hand, he should explain the Dharma:🔽“For the sake of benefiting all beings,🔽for the sake of protecting all the teachings,

original: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bstan pa thams cad bsrung phyir dang // 'dod kun bdag po nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan phyir dang // bstan pa thams cad bsrung phyir dang // 'dod kun bdag po nyid kyi phyir //
translated: for the sake of becoming the lord of all desires,

original: drag po'i las la gnas par gyis //
analyzed: drag po'i las la gnas par gyis //
translated: abide in the rite of Caṇḍa.”

original: de nas phyag rgya'i ye shes bslabs te gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya'i ye shes bslabs te gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then, having trained in the gnosis of the consort, one should give the sacrificial cake.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas mu med pas mthar thug cing mu med pa'i chos dang ldan pas yang cho ga 'di mthar thug par byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa byin gyis brlab pa rdo
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas mu med pas mthar thug cing mu med pa'i chos dang ldan pas yang cho ga 'di mthar thug par byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa byin gyis brlab pa rdo
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, endowed with the ultimate and limitless Dharma, in order to bless the ultimate of this rite, explained this method of the perfection of wisdom, called the blessing of the ultimate of the sameness of all phenomena,
